PM75unxA6THnosYNUAFmrw.text: I come out to this place at least twice a month, usually during happy hour from 10 pm to 2 am.  The location is suspect but this is the very first sushi place in LV so there you go.  The late night menu is awesome.  Ultimate osaka roll, japanese lasagna and kai's special are my favorites.  You can get stuffed with the happy hour appetizers too.  Try the chicken wings, the kalbi sticks and the fried rice.  Oh and the udon too.  I am not sure why some prior reviews say this place is expensive.  In my opinion, this place is very reasonable and I have not been disappointed.   P.S. Green tea tiramisu is really good.  A little expensive at $8 for a slice but splurge once in a while.

N3j47rB_Y6JEEmRqOL03vA.text: Great 911 roll if you like spicy. The oh my god roll is very tasty too. THe interior is very Japanese like, low floor tables and bamboo, nice atmosphere, friendly service

8IgfrOPXjGRScBdoMxbtmQ.text: This is our go to place for sushi.  Off strip, reasonable prices, good selection of sake.  They do a lot of other japanese food options that are good also.  Just make sure to go to Sahara.  The location on Eastern was not nearly as good.

Qtxf5grZSn-he9-cOoM-qQ.text: I have never been disappointed with this sushi Restaraunt for the past 15 years and I think there food is as good or better that any hotel for half the price. It's only 5 min from the strip and make sure you go to this one its the original location and far better than the other ones.

U_WE2_7_b8qVKPtwkm1dmg.text: I've been coming here my whole life. The zaru soba is good. The sushi used to be better. But I'll keep coming here because I have a place in heart for it.

VHPb1WCTLtFFbU9ltJqmfg.text: How can I be going to this place for 14 years and am just getting around to a review now?  I guess because I am too busy eating Japanese Lasagne ;)  Yes, that is your dessert, True sushi believers, trust me.  Ask for Mika and the nice fellow with short hair who gave me green tea once.  Also, splurge on their very special T-shirt that has a Sumo wrestler saying "will work for sushi."  You'll get it after your Osaka addiction has begun.  At the end of your meal, ask for an Osaka frequent card since you can use it as a credit on your next meal!  Ok does everyone know to leave your shoes outside the tatami room with toes outward?  You'll be instantly recognized as a regular ;)

riR7pXv5Ugbjz1cMvDLKwg.text: Really fresh sake. Great rolls. Nice option to get a half or a full roll. Delicious lychee sake. Fast service. Amazing!

pBIg48tuIGAtbxI6HS3xcQ.text: I like Osaka mostly because they have good sake samplers and decent food for those who don't eat fish.  I have been here with friends on numerous occasions and have always managed to find something to eat without fish.  Having lived in Japan for years, I like to think my broken nihongo has a hand in me getting what I would like...  Love the Inari and the tofu soup was bland but not too bad.  The tea here is one of the reasons I like to come here..sooo tasty.    The Sake is great I had rice, cold, warm and flavored and enjoyed almost all of it.  Great to go with a group of friends, sit in the back on the tatami and drink, eat and be merry.  The waiter was kind of nice to give us the some remainders of open bottles since were shutting the place down.  A big bonus because it was normally not something I would order because of the expense.    The place is good for groups, and the seating is somewhat private so you can have a good time.  Like all tatami you can take your shoes off and sit cross legged which I love.

tqrJQw6qsofqyneljpAGsg.text: Always love eating here. Service is always prompt and portion sizes are decent. 911 rolls and the (tonkatsu) are my favorite.  Don't forget to end on some delicious tempura ice cream.   One thing I deducted a star for was due to them serving wild caught bluefin tuna. Unfortunately, the species is predicted to be extinct by 2012.

o67Sqc42uCRCFZGDIgDM2w.text: I have been going to this restaurant for over 30 years.  I have always gotten excellent service.  My current favorite server is David.  The fresh tuna that my boyfriend eats is always fresh.  Their tempura udon soup is excellent.  I have never had a sushi roll there that I didn't enjoy.  One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.

jq4RyZv4vNh4KW0YbYX4Zg.text: I stopped writing reviews on Yelp because it was too time consuming, but after eating at this restaurant, I can't help but tell the world about our experience, one that I hope will make other people wary of coming here.  We arrived at Osaka on a typical Saturday afternoon (1pm-ish) and was shown a table in the back room (where the tables were larger).  As we walked past the first room upon entering, I noticed that it was fairly empty but it didn't struck me as odd since there are so many restaurants to choose from in Las Vegas.  We sat down and were given multiple menus, each one with something different in it.  I guess this could be a good thing since I like having lots of choices.  We ordered our drinks (hot green tea and iced green tea) and browsed the menus for omakase, which we heard from someone (ahem) that it is worth coming here for.  After everyone in our party arrived (there were 5 of us), we asked the waitress about their omakase and she completely hesitated. I thought that was strange considering this should be a simple question.  She said she'll be right back, so we sat there, thinking maybe she's just new or something.  But even so... o_O.  She came back and in broken English asked us if we wanted sashimi or sushi, and we said a little of both.  She then proceeded to say that it's $100 for all four people that wanted it, and I confirmed if it was $100 per person, or if it was $100 for all four people because that makes a HUGE difference.  She said $100 for four people, so we agreed.  After ordering the "omakase" - I realized that she must have ordered us the plate of normal sashimi/sushi that was on the menu.  I remember seeing $50 for 2 people for something, so with 4 people, she just doubled it.  I thought sure... why not.  We were going to try their assortment of rolls, but given that the omakase is supposed to be good, I decided to give it a try.  The first plate of sashimi came out looking decent.  I'm not too familiar with the names and the translation for the type of fish, so I'm just going to say that I tried just about everything on the menu and only a couple items tasted okay.  There were quite a few nasty bites in between, including one in which I had to spit out.  Now, I'm not a sushi snob at all, but when I have to do that, it means it's NOT good.  My companions agreed, and another person had to go thru that ritual later on in the meal as well (said one of the fish tasted grainy too).  Fortunately, our napkins were right in front of us.  =)  As an additional note, we received 2 additional plates of sushi rolls which were supposed to be part of the omakase deal.  We thought it was just so-so as well... perhaps even bad.  At the end of the meal, we noticed the $100 + $70 on top of our other charges.  We asked about the $70 and they said it was for the 2 plates of sushi rolls that accompanied our sashimi omakase plate. Needless to say, that $70 was a surprise because we were told  it was $100 for four people.  If they told us they were going to bring additional sushi plates for $35 each, I think we would've either said no, or ordered or own rolls.  Ugh.  I hate when mess-ups like this happen.  We told our waitress about the issue and she left to talk to the owner/mgr.  The owner/mgr. came by quite awhile later to ask us what the issue was.  We explained clearly about the unexpected charge and the miscommunication but he wouldn't budge.  In fact, he brought up how good of a quality the fish were, and given that, this is still a good deal.  The whole time, I kept thinking if I should tell the truth about the quality of his fish, but I kept my mouth shut in case he was going to give us a break.  I suppose we all could've said something because at the end, nothing happened out of the negotiation.  He wouldn't even take the charge of one $35 plate of sushi off, so we paid, left, and vowed never to come back.    I've had a lot of sushi before, but I would rank this as the worst sushi AND experience ever.  There are a ton of other great sushi restaurants in Vegas, so look it up on Yelp and go there.  You will not regret it.

oRcRbZFJu774UB0vf6i1Zg.text: Went here for my husbands birthday dinner (my first time here his second) and it was so good!  Ordered:  App. = Yakitori, tender chicken but the sauce was a little bland. Not awsome but not bad, meh.  Sushi Oh my God = wish I had gotten just this and the Cajun Crunch so that I could have eaten more of them before getting full. Will come back just for those next time.  Cajun Crunch = a little kick but not overwhelming heat. I could taste all the ingredients not just the spicy sauce so I was happy.   777 roll = if it wasn't for the 2 rolls listed above this would be my favorite. Did not over do it on the cream cheese and the sauce really worked well with the mild fish.  Fire Roll = good but not great, won't get it again in favor of other rolls.  Katie Maki = tasty and a little different from what I'm used too (haven't had a roll with mushroom in it before) but I would have liked a little more shiitake in there as it was a little hard to differentiate the flavor.  Yum Yum Roll = Hubby said this was his favorite from his previous trip so we ordered a whole roll (got half rolls of some of the above so we could try more) so when it came I was excited to try it. I was underwhelmed. It was fine, just a simple plain roll but compared to the other yummies on the table I didn't want to spare valuable stomach space on it. After a couple of pieces hubby did say that he must have remebered wrong about this roll.   Green Tea Mochi Ice Cream = I had no room for dessert but hubby had this and pronounced it "so tasty".   Our dining compainions don't do sushi so they got the terriyaki chicken and shirmp tempura and deemed them delecious.  I was a little nervous going in after reading reviews on here about bad service but I couldn't have been happier with our service. Plates were cleared quickly and drink were kept full and we felt well taken care of.   We will be back for sushi numminess soon.

RDZgZVbunfjLJ00KWVxDSA.text: I happen visit here by the search on the GPS. They open until 02:00am and have nice TaTami Table. Selection of apertizers and main Japanese foods are wide in addition to good sushi. It is satisfactable even by Japanese guests. The variety of Sushi is so wide and we could enjoy Aji, oh-toro, and chu-toro, etc, Impressive was fried rice that is exactly same to the one we can have in Japan. Although the most of the guests are Americans, I recommend here to Japanese peoples,

ihSOCn3QEtCpVgNn3sRWsg.text: I love coming here. Amazing sushi. But best of all its fried rice is like no other. I'm not a big sushi fan I don't order anything but crab, shrimp and salmon but I must say its very good here.

aW00EzxczAYGsgeHBl0bZQ.text: My first experience with real sushi (not grocery store or deli counter sushi).  Loved every bite.  Even got adventurous and ate the face off of a giant shrimp creature.  Eyeball stalks, and all.  That may have been a garnish.  I don't know, it was also my first fling with the sake.  Speaking of sake...this is also the only place I've found that served a particular sake which was brewed by females, to cater to females.  Came in a frosted pink bottle.  Little bit sweeter than other sakes I've tried, but good...and the bottle looked precious, with a pretty flower stuck in, nestled on my girlfriend's nightstand.    I tried many new things, here.  Sashimi of various sorts, seaweed salad, eel sauce, tako and tamago...always attractively presented and delicious.  Went here several times over the years in Las Vegas.  Never had a meal I didn't thoroughly enjoy, never had a server who wasn't friendly and outgoing, never had any fellow guests complain about taking off their shoes, never had a menu recommendation that went unappreciated,   never had a check that raised my eyebrows.    My only beef with the place was the smell...the last few times I went, everything past the sushi bar smelled like a sewer.  Now, I managed food places for a long time, and I know that once there's a problem in the lines under the building, it can be a bear (a big, angry, expensive bear) to get taken care of.  But in a sit-down joint with aspirations towards the classy, aged poo cannot be allowed to waft.    SO...if someone can confirm for me that the smell has been taken care of (my nose now being several hours to the south), I'll bump this review up a notch.

xmnx5SxBRSW8IgoppfUJSg.text: My favorite sushi place in town. Love all their rolls, they fish are really fresh and the chefs there are very creative. Everything I even try there are very yummy. The services are alway friendly. And they open late at night. This is one of those hidden neighborhood jem.  ALSO, lots of bad reviews regarding Osake are for the other one by Lake Mead, most people mistake the two. I been to that one too and they are one of the worst. It's night and day. Please don't let that mislead you.

lzfN3lTN6RO-m4Fe9pe1iw.text: I'm shocked by the negative reviews... I've been going to this restaurant for over 2 years and I have never had a bad experience. The sushi is always fresh, the service is great and I love the traditional seating. I will agree that the look from the outside and when first entering is a lil sketchy but it also gives it a lil character. This is the go-to spot for a midweek treat. I highly recommend the Omg roll. I crave it monthly.

Peg-9gHbo1D8y5amYxslww.text: best sushi place ive been to by far ! kinda pricy, but its worth it

xzul_Q_iIHWvQxiZsE2zkg.text: Stopped here on a whim, and was very pleased. We sat at the bar, and didn't even know how big the restaurant was. Great service and food- and let me just say- there is nothing wrong about the "something wrong" dish!! YUM!

LpyK6Zhp8hGWQHuyKPYAgA.text: This place is super cool considering it's in Vegas.  Japanese style tables, a sushi bar, and some pretty shockingly good food that's reasonably priced for it's proximity to the strip.  Don't expect anyone to know where this is if you're taking a cab.  Bring an address and have mapped it out first.  I thought that it was an abandoned building from the outside, but after entering through the air conditioning airlock, it was business as usual on the inside.  This may be my second favorite secret japanese place for when I'm in town.

g48Msdyzqg2m09ti49OwpA.text: Great Las Vegas staple....sushi is great fresh and prepared wonderfully. What a great place to enjoy Japanese in Vegas

WIT5r2apXQoZb0ch0rAzKQ.text: I walked in around 10pm without a problem, the restaurant was near empty but its understandable since its late. We were seated by the bar and the right away the chef greeted us kindly and were tended to with menus. Im not sure if it was the hunger i had but the food was delicious. I had a chicken skewer, which was a bit bland but the sushi was great. It did take a bit long to get our food but personally, it was worth the wait. Most definitely would return again.

6a4Zul4VFh2NhK2d1J2w9g.text: I've probably been here at least two dozen times. I LOVE this restaurant, and have been coming here for years. My go to is the teriyaki chicken and shrimp tempura lunch special. It comes with insane amounts of food, including rice, a small salad, and soup. The sushi is also really great, super fresh, and made very quickly.   The atmosphere is obviously a huge plus, as they have the Japanese floor tables and comfortable mats to sit on, as well as table seating.   The food always comes out quickly, the servers are friendly and knowledgeable, and I've never had any incorrect orders, food I didn't love, or any other reason to discourage others from going.   Also, it should be noted that it's far superior to the Osaka on Sahara, which is significantly worse and not worth the trip, at all.

rX9hFcxFbP-u2CYbWvhu0g.text: I honestly loved this place before. However,I get really mad about silly&rude service from waiter.  We sat in tatami and ordered 2 drinks. I waited my drink about 15mins and the waiter never shows up to bring my drink,and take order. It was slow on that night. He never come to my table even I called him. So I decided to go walk to him and ask where is my drink? And he answered me,'when you sit in tatami,you have to take off your shoes. I didn't bring your drinks cause you don't take off your shoes' WTF? Sorry to use bad word. But seriously. WTF. why don't you tell me when you let us sitting in tatami? If me,I will tell to customer when I bring drinks to them. You spent your 15mins to waiting us to take off the shoes? Wow I'm clapping to his patience!!  And who do you think you are? I thought he was my professor of Japanese culture! He was acting like I'm not giving you candy if you fail.   What a hilarious services I ever had in my life hahaha Btw food was so good!

q23BIN-mU91Mj5WyjSvPlw.text: Went here with a big group of girls. First loved the traditional seating. We got a ton of rolls and the lychee sake. It was all very good!  Not a single roll I did not like. The fish was fresh and the variety on the menu was great.  For dessert, go with the classic -tempura fried ice cream.

rcWLqBHl2i73v0GbSg8ncQ.text: This was our first visit to the HENDERSON LOCATION. So, the other location in Summerlin may be better.   My wife and I ate here as members of a birthday celebration. When the reservations were for 6 people, and 7 showed up, they treated it as if it was a great inconvenience. Prior to being seated for dinner, we had to wait quite a while to get drinks. And even then they were out of a few beers. The waitress was not a bartender by any means. She was confused about the ingredients of basic cocktails.   The manager, who sits at the front door was in no way accommodating or friendly. We did not feel welcomed or comfortable upon our arrival. Perhaps it was the additional member of our party that upset him. We felt as if we were an inconvenience.   That being said, the food was good. We had the combination dinner with steak and seafood. The preparation and presentation were really nice. Our chef was humorous and entertaining. The food was hot and flavorful. The sauces were outstanding.  So, we were happy with the food and unhappy with the hospitality. That being said, we will try it again and hope we our experience will be better. Worth giving it a try!

BedzaNaMvfXVEXKg8lYdLQ.text: Very good quality and great prices! Best of all you can get delivery from them :) I'm always skeptical getting sushi delivery because it's not a food that sits well for long. Tried the delivery though and it was so fresh! Definitely recommend this place if you want quality but don't want to break the bank.

NxPLWMC784h4IDPGD-9Z6A.text: Very good sushi. It is extremely delicious. I remember eating here with my parents and the service was top notch.

K1nHm-bFNtzflI9YECQ3Yw.text: Today was my birthday and my children decided to take me to the Osaka Japanese restaurant on Sahara. We sat down excited about the fun of celebrating, expecting an entertaining chef. Instead we had to endure watching a chef struggle through preparing our dinner. He was totally unsure of himself and acted very confused. He kept dropping the utensils then bending down to pick them up off the floor, proceeding to wipe  them off with a wet towel...then reusing them. He could only prepare one item at a time and it was so stressful to watch. His knife skills were a d- at best. Not to mention that he brought out two pieces of meat, with one looking fresh and the other looking brown and old.  My daughter asked him about the color of the meat and he said it was fine. Then he offered to cover it in teriyaki sauce to improve the bad smell and taste. My daughter had to excuse herself to the restroom because she felt nauseous knowing it would make her sick if she ate that steak. I then told the very nice waiter what was going on and he explained we were the first people he had prepared a meal for. I said that the chef told us he had been working there twelve years. He said, yes, that was True....but he was working there in other jobs like bussing tables. I could go on about this negative experience but must stop with this final thought...I just do not understand and it is beyond me how they could let an untrained incompetent person play chef at the expense of their unsuspecting customers. Very disappointed!

zwqGQP_7lDzUvFXx3ieC2A.text: We unfortunately got a chef on his first night and we were his first table. He came to the table and seemed quite unsure of himself when he lit the grill the flames were very high and he let it stay lit until it burned away. He was only able to start to cook one thing at once, until he was finishing cooking my lobster. He then added raw chicken to the grill and used the same spatula and knife and than tossed my lobster with it. This was a cross contamination and it was disgusting to watch. We ordered fried rice and he left egg shells in it. He did no special tricks except trying to set the onion on fire, but he even messed that up. He kept dropping the towels and than picking them up to wipe of his spatula and knife. The worst part was when he put the steaks on the grill.  One was bright red and looked fresh the other one was brown. We pointed out the steak being brown he said it was only cut an hour ago. He offered to put teriyaki sauce on it to cover up the mistake. When he put it on my plate it had a bad smell. I refused to eat it. We explained to the waiter who was nice that we were not happy. They still made us pay for all the meals, but took of a small amount for the steak. This was a terrible experience and unfortunately my Mother's birthday and now her memory of her special day is tainted.

7s720_YD4r8kzIacS_acAA.text: Been her since 6pm, on time, and Teppanyaki chef didn't start till a little after 7 pm. Unacceptable! We come here a lot and this experience has been not up to par. Plan to be here at least 2-3 hours for Teppanyaki. Do not go on Mondays

cpe8k2KZ8bwPwN3WkbAsIA.text: I'm rating 2 stars because the food arrived very quickly. I have been eating at this restaurant since my cousins family opened. Although the food arrived quickly it was cold and the portions were very small. It was average teriyaki at best.  Very tough slice of beef and very dry. Gyoza was over cooked.

qdiwSlASSJIqXna2_ATyBw.text: The only reason this is getting 2 stars is because the Filet Tataki was amazing.. But this is sushi, not a steakhouse.  We have been waiting on our check for quite some time and didn't even bother to finish our food because all of it, was not to our liking.  Wishing the check would come so we can just go to In n Out

DIi8PRRWN_qNyw4mXcuIJw.text: The menu is huge and covers any mood your taste buds are in...plus they have a great late night memu until 2 am! The food, especially the seafood...is so fresh and is highest quality. The service from all is wonderful...but kenji the sushi chef is phenomenal and really enhances the ecperience through great convos!

W6HPiYzOqFdKkW_003ir_Q.text: This place is great for a sushi night ! It can be a bit pricey and the sushi is kind of smaller than the average sized sushi but the quality of the sushi is just amazing makes up for it  so it's well worth the price!

wAZ65mZbWRwII-1PfkbM0w.text: All I can say about the sushi here is it's amazing. I told my wife to take me somewhere we have never been for sushi together and she chose Osaka because she remembered loving it 6 years ago. Now here for some information on Osaka.  Exterior: I would consider this a hidden gem that is in plain view. I have passed it easily 20-30 times without ever noticing it. It looks like your average chinese restaurant with small signs and red neon lighting all around the place. Don't let this deceive you.  Interior: As soon as you enter the building you feel like your'e in a different world. I'm not saying it's high class but compared to the exterior it looks good. They have three different areas to sit depending on the experience you would like which I enjoyed. You can have your usual sushi experience next to the sushi bar with a couple small tables for couples, a sushi chef prepare your food directly infront of you while he is doing all kind of tricks and making balls of fire, who doesn't like fire? And lastly they take a more traditional approach which I did and liked, you go to a seperate room with enclosed booth style seating where you remove your shoes and sit on small cushions. Cool experience.  Staff: The staff were great. Everyone acted professionally, gave advice on what rolls were ordered most and preferred by other guests, and the service was on point.  Now for the most important part, sushi: The sushi was absolutely amazing!!! We ordered the "Titanic boat" which came with a large variety of sushi on a huge boat. It came with 12 pieces of Nigiri (6 salmon, 3 albacore, and 3 tuna) and they melted in your mouth. The fish was so delicate and well prepared I will definitely be back for more. It also came with 5 other half rolls. I apologize as I can't remember the names of them but can assure you each and every bite was delicious. I have been to numerous sushi restaurants in town, many in California, and have a friend who owns one in south Vegas, and this destroys them all. Sorry for being a traitor if you read this buddy.  I will upload pictures later for all of you to drool at your computers. Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Titanic sushi boat $50

dVndSy9-YLZ0Fzjv6ML2Ow.text: A colleague took us here for dinner, being one of his favorites when in town.  I let them order and everything was fantastic. We sat in the area with the traditional tables which was fun. The people were very friendly and accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their orange treat for the end of your meal

A6rCiF62uMvtWipkPZnt2Q.text: This restaurant is wonderful! It is lovely inside. The decor is beautiful and clean. The staff is very friendly and the sushi is fresh and very well prepared!   They also have bento boxes for those who aren't into sushi, which are among the best I've seen. They aren't stingy with the plates and everything is fresh and flavorful! I have been back several times over the past few weeks and they are consistent.   I would recommend this restaurant to anyone without worrying about it missing the mark. Bravo!

EyMJ8QDoe_6dJyFUIgI34g.text: This restaurant  is so weird. I made a reservation but  they said they dont take reservation from 4-8pm ...just after 8pm  for night . We are fine with that . that is why we take 8pm with show cooking on table...but when we come on time, they don't put us on  that table instead other one. They said we need to wait for 30mis. We are ok...but after that they said we need to wait more time... so bad. We take reservation already. Why we need to wait many time. We spend 30mins for driving to this restaurant...but it is tooooooo....o bad.  I don't eat food yet so i give this restaurant 2 stars for bad treatment.

At the time, the food was an overall good meal, however I started the worst food sickness about 3-5 hours later. This, I will never forget. uRvM7yz4Ps1keAVifB6tCQ.text: If I could give this place no stars, I would. We placed an order online under the impression that we were paying $60 for 4 rolls. What we got instead was 16 pieces. DON'T BUY FROM THEM. They will rip you off. When we called to complain, the manager, Dave, was rude, unsympathetic that their website was misleading, and tried to blame the delivery company for making the order wrong. Talk about misplaced blame and unaccountability. Horrible business and even worse customer service.

uP07c7kEiovb0lIMSHRHAA.text: One of the best sushi restaurant in Vegas. I've tried many different sushi here and they were all delicious and fresh. Especially the special fish off the menu board were so authentic. Staff is very good and polite. Chef is very professional. Atmosphere was nice. They have many Japanese "tatami"style booth, very private. You feel like eating sushi in Japan!!!  I definitely recommend this place and come back soon!!!!

S4JVIZMrfRwRb1xMW5TLUA.text: Overpriced restaurant and plenty of MSG in their food. Looking for a heart attack or a stroke? This is the place. Service is up & down.

pJiL6Q46CLRDV_Vjyubjwg.text: Decided to come over here off the strip with some friends.  And since I rarely go off-strip whenever I'm in Vegas, I figured I'd give it a shot and grabbed a taxi.  That said, I was generally impressed by the ratio of price to sushi during lunch time compared to sushi on the strip.  The quality was pretty good overall.  Though, I honestly forgot what I ordered though since I had more sake than sushi (something along the lines of a badass samurai or something), but I had no issues with the sushi.

k7zNrfXAYTxDEo_8Sml5iQ.text: After a few failed attempts at other sushi restaurants ended up here as a last resort... I'm glad we came here food is amazing, fresh and delicious. Great customer service!

Hqgg2n0pSBegk6aL3VE4nA.text: Food was okay and came in a timely manner. I was disappointed with the customer service. They were very monotoned, and in my eyes customer service can always hype an over-all experience. I'm giving a poor rating and won't recommend any family or friends. This experience was nothing special and won't be remembered. If the staff manager reads these reviews I encourage coaching your team to be more personable.

77Z6U7JF4THkRSNzIp78jw.text: I always past by this place on Sahara so I decided to finally try it, been there forever so it must be good. Thankfully it was, if there was a standard for authenticity it would be this place. Felt like I was actually in Japan! I ordered the tiger roll and the sassy roll. The fish is fresh which is the reason why the rolls are so expensive. They do not have AYCE but the rolls are decent. If you are in the mid for AYCE this is not the place you want to go.   Their service is great! The ambiance is amazing also, the tables are set like traditional Japanese tables where you sit on your knees and eat. Now if that's not your thing the table are dug in underneath so you can sit like you are at a normal table. All in all a defined must come/go. Food is good and the service is great!

ekPh8HzUhdoRqji2NCxH5g.text: Normally I would never give one star, but this place justifies it! I have been in Vegas for over 20 years, been to this and the Summerlin Osaka several times - however this experience was horrible! First, with how old this place is and how much they charge, update your business! When you walk in, the other review that says this place is like a crack house is very correct! That is the only way to describe the experience when you walk in. Further, nothing has been updated since this place opened ... even the bathroom, with the overflowing dirty toilet!  Now on to the service, very rude and a "no-it-all" with zero customer service skills.  We went in because of the sign that said "Late Night Specials" - I called and was told many of the rolls were very discounted. The truth is, they are half rolls! AND if you ordered a whole roll off of the main menu, it would have been cheaper then two half rolls. Do you think because it is late night in Vegas, people will eat less, so it is a deal? If you order a half roll from the late night specials, you save an average of $.25. Really? This is your draw to get people in? Very deceptive. The quality of the food was OK, nothing amazing - and not even sure if what we got was what we ordered. Also, do not expect a refill on your water or tea or beer for that matter.   So many better late night places in Vegas that actually wants repeat business.

QxdD8GnBsVV5mdg0E2B91Q.text: Best sushi in town! Always fresh and great customer service:) Asakusa roll is my fave!

P6FCJBS1bQpR82FVTPg8qg.text: My friends and I go here all the time, sushi is awesome. Everyone is super friendly. And the desserts are the bomb!

crfnSWe1APoxSON1zXtWiw.text: The best Japanese in Las Vegas!!!  I have been to a lot of Japanese places in LA and Vegas and food, drinks, decor, service as well as unique sushi is awesome!!

hovDkhIcJFfOMUbqpP6qRg.text: Ate here for dinner with a friend around 8pm on Jan 13. Had some rolls and appetizers. Woke up at 2am violently throwing up. Woke up again at 5am throwing up. My friend was sick all night as well and this was the only meal we both ate. Still feeling sick.   Will never eat at Osaka again.

qhORHuhlP42QCYpBz6q5Ig.text: Wow, I can't believe this place has 4 stars! I wasn't impressed at ALL! I came here for a bday dinner for a friend, and the place was already chosen, or else I would have suggested someplace different. It doesn't look very inviting.   We were there on a Thurs. night around 8 and were ushered into the back where the teppan tables are. For one, our table was right next to the kitchen door, which was distracting, and it wasn't busy so we could have been seated elsewhere. The atmosphere was shabby - maybe it was because of where we were seated (other parts of the restaurant looked like they may have been nicer) - not very warm or upkept. It seemed like it had been a while since they decorated. Just.. kind of shabby.   Anyway, we ordered some drinks, then three of the four of us ordered meals from the teppan-dinner menu, and the fourth ordered from the sushi menu. Our drinks came at a decent time, except for one of my friends, who later actually had to remind the waiter about it - turns out the waiter forgot. Speaking of the waiter: he was a very nice man, but he kept butting into our conversations! I think it was his way of giving "good customer service" but it got a little awkward after a while, when he kept adding little tidbits and comments to what we were saying.   We actually had some friends that would be joining us later in the evening, but the waiter made sure to tell us that the chef only cooked at the teppan once per table. That's understandable. My friend who ordered from the sushi menu got his food before the tepan chef even came out for our orders, which I thought was a little uncoordinated. Again - it wasn't busy at all. There was only one other teppan table with people and they were on dessert.   Our chef comes out of no where. He's not pushing a cart because the cart has been sitting by our table the entire time, as if they had just left it after the last "presentation." I get that it may be more convenient, but c'mon. It looks bad, and also doesn't imply "freshness." (He did bring the meats and main ingredients out fresh, the cart had the sauces and butter and stuff). So our chef comes out, doesn't introduce himself or anything, just starts cooking. I've been to a teppan-style restaurant before that does this "presentation," but for my friend who hadn't, he didn't even know there was going to be a show! He just thought the guy was cooking in front of us.   Our chef, while nice, was nervous and messed up about every 4-5 tricks that he did. I was kind of embarrassed for him, but I know he did his best. To be honest, though, because of his lack of being personable, it was kind of awkward to sit there and have a conversation while this guy is just doing random tricks at the table. It wasn't engaging enough for us to actually pay attention to him. Osaka didn't deliver on this experience at ALL. The worst part was that this guy's manager (I assume) was watching the whole time, which was even making us uncomfortable.  The food was just okay. Nothing I remember, and honestly, better Japanese food can be found elsewhere for much, much cheaper. After we finished eating, we were hanging around waiting for our other friends to show up, and it took them a long time to clear our plates. The chef came out about a half hour after we finished eating to clean the teppan; didn't say a word again.   Luckily, we had a gift card so we didn't end up paying much after it was applied, because I would have regretted spending anymore than I did. It is way overpriced for what you get (it may have been a different story if we actually got the experience we were hoping for). It is cheaper than Benihana but it is NOT worth the discount. If you want a great teppan-dining experience, splurge and go to Benihana. Everything there is miles better. Don't bother with this place if you're going for that.

T9LQ3sE682RUvrSamxTOog.text: When in Vegas recently for a business conference, my sales reps chose this place for dinner after hearing the rave reviews of how Osaka came highly recommended.  I was up for Japanese cuisine and something different from all the flashy tourist places on the strip.  The restaurant is definitely low key, casual and with no glitz whatsoever.  In fact, it looked pretty run down but definitely a favorite and popular place with the locals.  We requested a Japanese table that involved taking off your shoes and sitting down on cushions.  It was pretty run down and when seated and hanging my bare feet down under the table onto the old carpet, I couldn't help but wonder about the numerous pairs of bare feet that touched this very spot prior to me.  Perhaps my 3 stars is due to not being a seafood or fish lover.  I stuck to a teriyaki chicken and steak combo that was dry and just meh.  Rest of my party ordered various fish dishes that were okay but not exceptional.  I also ordered a California maki that came cold and didn't taste freshly made.  The plus, this place was pretty inexpensive verses restaurants on the strip.  It's good to see Osaka has a loyal following and good business.  Service was good too.  Perhaps just a place that wasn't for me.

AO5ZQcV0UD7i1vQrWXt4Ng.text: Came to Osaka really late during my trip out to Vegas to check out the happy hour with some friends, and saw this place had great reviews.  We certainly didn't have a terrible experience, but I can't say I'd come here again.  I got a California Roll, chicken wings and shared a Japanese Burger sushi which was weirdly unique but tasted pretty good.  The California roll tasted odd, I'm not sure if the avocado was in the best shape, but it was alright.  The chicken wings were cool too, and we also shared some edamame.  But the prime reason I'm giving this place 1 star is the price.  This place is ridiculously expensive.  Even a plain 6-piece cucumber roll was $4.  You can get that other places for a buck.  And this was happy hour!   I can get way better sushi for a fraction of cost elsewhere.  No thanks, Osaka.

KZc0BUiktm0vZh1pXQcOmQ.text: Amazing food. I order to go from here 2-3x a week. However, tonight I called to place a to go order and I was very rudely told that they no longer accepted to-go orders over the phone and that I would have to come in and place my order. What? If I wanted to sit there for 30 minutes I would just dine-in. Extremely disappointed to be treated like this by a place I've been patronizing for a long time. I love the food but will no longer be giving this place my business. 5 stars for food quality, 1 for customer service. Beyond disappointed in you Osaka.

iPaSYZYdIdYrqzRYVhUs6A.text: Sushi and Tapan. We began with Sushi Rolls. All fresh and very tasty. Next was the Tapan table. Great chef. Did the usual show with the flying spatulas and the famous Egg Roll. The food was delicious and the service was excellent as well. As soon as someone's drink was nearly empty, our servers were all over it. This is a do over next time I'm in Vegas

M-W1tCvkGTVwgnCp3XPuAg.text: I love Osaka but a few things I didn't like like the fried rice and had king crab sushi once that had ice particles.

EhpItHkWFS8_Dymd65o1Ag.text: This place is great for a late night sushi craving since they stay open until 2am. Its got traditional Japanese seating,  restaurant, sushi bar or Teppanyaki. You have lots of choices on how to dine. The sushi is good but the choices could be better. I prefer fresh sushi rolls and I think their fresh rolls lack creativity. They have a good selection of tempura and deep fried rolls. The prices are a little much for what they offer and the 1/2 rolls menu is not much of a deal in my opinion. Its a cool place but not my favorite.

1OIEHnvRJSFJ3CJdRTj2mw.text: Desserts are excellent. Fried oreo was yummy. Sorry to inform everyone but happy hour equals half a roll! Just not what I am used to when I go for happy hour.

O-RxuogP1p9e7ekV6dn8-A.text: Vast menu and really well executed Japanese fairs.  Casual yet elegantly presented decor.  You will enjoy coming back to try new dishes/styles

NkvzdfeIGMveK6RrNAiszA.text: We had Osaka cater sushi for our wedding October 15th at Rainbow Gardens in Vegas and they were amazing to work with. Even though we had a small wedding David & Daniel made me feel like I was their most important customer!! They were awesome at communicating with me, especially since I was planning my wedding from Idaho. They were so friendly and wonderful work with. Our guests loved the sushi and we have nothing but great things to say about our experience. Gene, the owner even took time from his trip in Japan to call me and make sure I was taken care of! I highly recommend them for your even! Thank you guys!!

UqcfzoUY1ThWtjCH76UH2g.text: Favorite sushi in town. High quality sashimi and nigiri, and perfectly proportioned rolls. It's great for a lunch at the sushi bar, a romantic dinner for two with some character, a party, or even the tables for a 'show' experience for a large group. Has always been a Vegas staple and still is.

v3yILbX5CDUM1ZVeW0DNQQ.text: Great ambience. I love the customer service here i been coming here for a little over a year now. I am NOT very open to many sushi restaurants because i have gotten sick. I have NEVER gotten sick here at osaka and my food from the kitchen is always fresh and Hot.   I onyl eat a few things in a sushi Restaurant and its usually not on the menu and have to be customized to my liking... they always make my custom sushi roll to my liking with a smile every time s/o to Heimi hes a Kool Guy. I also eat shrimp Ebbi whichi is great here as well. See pics below for what I eat every time. Thanks Osaka

-HlQ8MQ3ChW6vw6MyDH-rQ.text: This has been my favorite sushi place for YEARS. The quality surpasses anyone's in town. Nigiri, rolls, dessert, everything is incredible. Thank you, please never close.

ymSTd1ATHfM1EcpXdv_E5g.text: Best place for authentic Japanese food in Las Vegas, period. Always ask for a tamari room if they've got one avaiable and for a "house soup" with the meal just in case you get tired of having miso soup every time. :)

i8KjndHWPUFs429TQ_NoGg.text: My favorite sushi restaurant! I don't live in Las Vegas, but this place is a must anytime I'm there. I actually dream of it when I'm back in LA. Even surrounded by all the sushi places here, I still love this restaurant the most.

Xco3_m7vzbRiIyh3GfwJow.text: Food A+.  Atmosphere, Okay.  5 stars because when we go out to eat we are looking for quality food, not entertaining decor.  My husband and I have a hard time finding resturants that are as tasty or better than what we can make at home (we are sorta food nerds). We went to Osaka last night for our daughter's 10th birthday and after a little bit of a rocky start (we got confused and couldn't find the entrance to the grill area) we were happily seated and served.  We came because our 10 year old LOVES Hibachi and we had read that Osaka was the original place for sushi in Vegas so we thought...okay lets do it.   1) My husband is not a sushi fan and HE was impressed by the quality of the sushi....so we can go again!!!! Yahoo!   We did three orders of customized sushi as well as a selection of standard nigiri and were impressed by all of them.  1) the fresh halibut recommended by the server...WOW!  2) the Thai Hamachi....WOW!, and 3) the (I think) Firery Roll? (on the top right hand of the custom creations menu) the texture was amazing.  For me the Ikura was a little bit salty and not super firm but when the nigiri was eaten as a whole "bite" the sushi rice and wrap balanced that saltiness...I just like to eat egg by egg sometimes...to lengthen the experience. My daughter and Husband orderd the chicken and new york steak Habachi and I got an extra plate (I am more of the sushi eater).  The steak was very very good and very well cooked.  Too many times the meat at hibachi is over cooked.  Not so here, our cook was more of an extermely skilled and social cook than an entertainer and I can say how grateful we are.  The vegetables and meats were beautifully cooked!   I am actually willing to order scallops on the hibachi here...I will try next time....in the past the only times I have had good scallops (meaning not over cooked and leathery) at the Hibachi place was at coastal locales where the seafood was probably purchased from the boat dock down the street.  Judging from the skill of the hibachi chef and the quality of the sushi, I can't wait to try other items on the menu! Also:  they surprised my daughter with a classic ice cream parfait glass with a round of happy birthday at no charge.  So Happy. Then, we got the bill. I was stunned.  SO Reasonable for the quality of the food.  We are giong back.  Happy Tummy

2QcCxPRFyuWJPI92XO5A8g.text: LOVE the Japanese Lasagna!! I recently had some on my visit, they have yummy flavored sake as well.  I miss eating sushi like this since moving from Las Vegas.  They have a good happy hour menu and prices as well, will definitely make it in on my next visit!

jg-OwGU_D1wKNFuZirbLHQ.text: Forget the over priced strip...This is the place to be! Amazing food & impeccable service! I can't recommend it enough. This is where the Las Vegas locals go. Love the traditional seating & how the servers take their time explaining each dish. You will not be let down. Half the price of the strip & twice as good!!  In one word....Go!!!

6NdAXj9FvWdov21tSQJxlQ.text: Amazing food amazing service. They refilled my drink so often, people were so nice, food was tasty :)

lFEGJYCNoqOnpK6_ldRGtw.text: Osaka really provides a stellar EXPERIENCE while you eat great food- with a sushi bar, tatami rooms OR teppan grill tables.  With their standard menu spanning almost 10 pages theres certainly no shortage of that while also not dominishing any of the specialty in their dishes they manage to offer a lot more diversity than your typical china town sushi place- even in the typical dishes.  They are always willing to customize & offer extremely attentice service, accompanying their ginger/wasabi with a lightly dressed cucumber salad.  O

C0kVfU6UqOzSmu6JHwMcMg.text: First time here at Osaka.  My sweetheart brought me here and we had the treasure chest , totally like it the tempura was on  point and so was the tuna salad .  Never had warm sake my baby popped my cherry on that one and im still on the fence on SAKE!!. She just ordered dessert Tempura ice cream with chocolate syrup in sure its going to be off the hook , cant go wrong with any kind of ice cream. Moderately priced and good fish quality. I recommend the tatami room if your good and fit but if your a big boy like get the regular table ! Since dinner started I've been planning my exit from the table, we will be coming back fo sho.

YYGvjT4R_Pi9aArCAXnmlQ.text: Came here to try this place on a Wednesday night. We wanted to sit in those booths that you take your shoes off Japanese style. I love this concept. Only thing I would have to say is that the pillows to sit on in this room is kinda old. Some looked new but some were old or dirty. Our servers did an excellent job bringing out everything fast and tending to us. My boyfriend and I ordered the Ron Special Boat. It was filling and good. Didn't care for the potato salad that came with the boat. Everything else was good. The sauce for the tempura was my boyfriends favorite sauce. Before we got our boat we got a refreshing cucumber salad and the miso soup with noodles in it. I love that their soup has noodles in it! It was delicious. The cucumber salad was really good and part of my favorite as well! I also ordered some hot sake. It was smooth and the server did a great job recommending the sake choice for me.  Our Ron special boat had beef, chicken yakitori, came with rice, potato salad, sashimi (salmon, tuna, and I believe yellowtail), California roll, and tempura. It filled the two of us up and we had to get the rest to bring home. Their desserts looked good as well. I think this is a good spot for hibachi and Japanese dining. I think if they updated the pillows then the place would have a better new look and feel to it.

BALB1hXR1iH1qoG_Nc2NPg.text: One of my favorites places for sushi! It's definitely a dive and it's been there forever but the service and quality is top notch.  My favorite rolls are the Pocket Aces and the Fresh White, but any of the others are great too. The place has recently been seen some minor remodeling such as the carpet and walls of the sushi bar. Size of rolls isn't always consistent, just depends on sushi chef.

7hv2hR4rwcmMQl7sqvNDeQ.text: I loved it. Sat down at the sushi bar and right away got greeted and asked what i like to drink. Very attentive and quick with the food. Food was delicious, fresh and just yummy. I will most definitely be going back if I'm ever in Vegas again. Oooh and asked for a roll that wasn't on the menu and with no hesitation he agreed to make it for me which I loved. Thank u!!! Ooh and lunch prices were just right.

Mann8iFAPzaTtC_TptyWLA.text: I ordered a take out of about 4 sushis rolls and they were all delicious ! I had the Crunchy Tako, The White Tiger, The Virgin and the Pollo Loco. The customer service was also delightful, the servers kept on offering me water while waiting for my order. Very nice place !

zfBnc80wGMe9iqLdidUkxA.text: I happened to catch Diners, Drive ins and dives on Food Network the other evening and they featured Osaka Japanese Bistro.  Being new to Vegas, we depend on Yelp for restaurant recommendations.   Naturally, I pulled Osaka on Yelp and the reviews were not bad so my husband and decided to eat here on Sunday.   It was around 1:30 when we pulled up and we were able to find a parking space. Warning, the parking lot is very small.  We opened the door and literally hit a wall.  You can either go right or left to enter the restaurant but there was no sign on why there were 2 different entrances.  Odd but we decided to make a right and enter another set of doors.  You run into a dining room with a sushi bar on the right.  I'm assuming the hostess station is in the middle of the restaurant but not sure.  Just a very strange layout for first timers.   We sat at a table and waited for our waiter.  After 10 minutes, our waiter asked if anyone has taken our drink order which we replied no.  He promptly took our drink order while we viewed the menu.  We took advantage of the lunch menu and their special.  From the lunch menu we ordered: Kamikaze and Tiger rolls in addition to beef yakisoba.  From the daily special menu we ordered the King Crab roll.   The rolls were ok.  On both the Kamikaze and Tiger the sauce was very salty.  Yakisoba was very good.  The beef was really tender.  The king crab roll was nothing special.  Overall. Glad we tried it but will try other sushi restaurants.

UxANrVEKr6qRw1QewxwsWQ.text: Went to Osaka tonight for something lighter after a heavy lunch. Chose it as part of a DDD food adventure while in Vegas. Outside is nothing much to look at but inside is quite authentic and the staff, especially Jared, were fantastic. Thought the prices were very reasonable.   Went with a couple of standards as a baseline and a few of Jared's recommendations. Everything was very good but the special cucumber salad, spicy garlic edamame and roppongi roll were top of the list. Delicious. Wish we had more time so we could go back. Might have to skip something else so we can. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

FPnMA2WzpTTXTu1zg5rQBw.text: Flying into Vegas on Southwest Airlines, I watched an episode of Triple "D" showcasing Osaka Japanese Bistro.  So, we had to go there.  WOW.  The craftmanship, authinticity and amazing skill with every plate was amazing.  You will not leave this place without a smile on your face.  You will enjoy.  #Awesome.

AMqRjlVdBpGh155WITzkMA.text: My husband and I came here on first trip to Vegas; and we weren't really expecting much because it's a little in coast and were from the coast. But we were wrong. Their sushi is exceptionally good. We got the tons special and it can definitely feed more then 2! We also got a few other things too. The service was really good; our server David was very attentive. They have some food options for desert. I would for sure recommend banana foster cake!

SjCII90SlHPauvCDqlsPNg.text: The BEST spot for teppan in Las Vegas. My husband and I love this place! It's the chef that really makes the experience with teppan and chef phong at this location is fantastic! Such a friendly guy and his food is exceptional. Tonight my husband ordered the lobster and it was some of the best we have ever had. The rolls are quite good as well and they also have the traditional Japanese area with the low tables and floor mats which is very cool. Definitely worth giving it a try, you won't regret it!

Q5rMTX6FPJklsN8cNbyQ0w.text: DO NOT BE SCARED WHEN YOU WALK IN. The entrance hall looks like a crack house. The restaurant you see when you get there is cramped and claustrophobic. so ASK FOR A BOOTH.There is a charming, intimate room in the back, shoes off, kneel down japanese tables. The food and service is great, a little pricier than several local places.

9m5EYAiCS0qzlWjbxP5YJw.text: Had a fantastic time here with a fairly large party!  The staff was very accommodating and we weren't made to feel like an inconvenience even with the size of our group.  The place has a very authentic feel and I very much enjoyed the Sushi, as well as some of the specialty beverages that they serve.  Worth a visit if you are in the area.

JxZwlDXmtSbq3aOQxW72IA.text: I have to admit that I really like Japanese food, and there is quite a few excellent restaurants in Las Vegas. This is the one I go to if I want Teppanyaki. They grill the food in front of you and you can choose what you want to eat. As starter you can of course get a miso soup that is very good. I would recommend the mixed teppanyaki. The sushi here is also good, but nothing super special in my opinion.  I will come back here for sure. The service is very good.   My other two Japanese favorites in town is Yonaka Modern Japanese and Raku

O--kCEFf_6TcnvK5SaMfZg.text: Hands down, the absolute BEST Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas! The best sushi I ever had! You can't beat this place. This is what all Japanese restaurants should be measured against. I love this place and can't wait for my next trip to Vegas to go here!

5l-dSutzvwanmULCWJKu-w.text: It's been a long time since I last visited Osaka. Boy, what a difference. It used to be a traditional Japanese restaurant, but now, it's turned into a fusiony bistro. I should've read the reviews on here before going.  The restaurant is now separated into tatami rooms, teppanyaki, sushi bar etc -- we got the tatami room.... which was fine. We got a sushi platter, zaru soba, selections from their robatayaki menu and agedashi tofu. The zaru soba was actually really good. Robatayaki items weren't bad either -- skimpy portions though. The sushi however, blows! I was so damn disappointed in the poor quality we were given. They used to be fantastic.  After this visit, I really won't be returning again. I like my sushi traditional. I'm kinda a stickler about that. The agedashi tofu was quite dismal too, not True authentic agedashi tofu at all. It was so dismal that the young man refused to eat it and he was the one who ordered it.  The service was attentive though hence the extra star. They have a late night menu with discounted prices after 10pm.

XbuZSZcumjtF7DZ4_Zmi_A.text: The sushi is fine but I can't even go out to eat without some liberal at the next table hooking me into her brand of politics. Now. I don't mind idle friendly chit chat with fellow diners but I keep it on the weather. She seemed intent on verbally haranguing and Harassing me. For 20 minutes she relentlessly yammered on and on about liberal politics and female white privilege. This woman was belligerent and looking for an argumentI couldn't even look at the menu as her voice was too loud to concentrate over. She's not the type that will allow you to ignore her. So much for being nice and it's my bad for even making eye contact with a lone diner. I feel like an idiot even giving people the time of day.

hh7f7oFBFEzCwCcmEZkMLQ.text: I put one star because I had too. The manager / owner and he was also the bartender. Was very rude unprofessional and have a problem with African Americans. The hostess said our table was ready but once the last person comes we will be seated. Once we all were there and saw us. She walked right by us with people. We Did not get a chance to eat because our table was given away after five minutes to accommodate another party. Manager and bus boy very confrontational. When asking questions about our reservation he got very irate and just wanted to kick us out.

YOhwYeXd3iKEq0S_0uka2w.text: Saw Osaka Japanese Bistro highlighted on a recent Triple D episode and had to try it. We were in Vegas for the weekend and sick of casino food so this was the perfect alternative.   Restaurant atmosphere:  My mom - born and raised in Osaka, Japan - was skeptical as soon as we pulled into the parking lot. She was even more skeptical as we entered the establishment. We were greeted with a black wall! It's drab, a bit dark and the decor is sadly lacking in so many ways...outdated, dingy and not so appealing.   We opted to sit in the tatami room vs. at the tables near the sushi bar. The set-up...taking off of the shoes, tatami mats (I suspect those tatami mats haven't been cleaned in a long time!) GROSS.   If you know anything about the Japanese culture you know that cleanliness is at the top of the list. The second generation owners of this establishment need to take note of this and make an effort to create an atmosphere which is bright, clean and inviting.   Food: Mom ordered the sashimi and tempura combo $22. She said the sashimi was delicious but she was not happy with the rest of her meal. The sunomono cucumbers were crunchy and they're not supposed to be served that way. The rice - plain ol rice - was not cooked thoroughly. RICE - served any way is KEY in any respectable Japanese restaurant!! The miso soup was ok. I ordered the Nebeyaki Udon. The base was good but overall I wasn't impressed.   The rolls are way too overpriced and I just wasn't going to pay $15-$20 for a 'specialty' roll!   Service: our waitress was super nice. I think her name was Haruko. She spoke fluent Japanese which was a plus for my mom. She made suggestions, was attentive and checked in on us several times. There were additional servers that came to check on our dining experience as well and they were very nice as well.   The restroom: F'in disgusting!!! What the heck! You couldn't even wash your hands as there was only a trickle of water! Is this the ONLY restroom in the establishment???!!! Is this where the servers, cooks and SUSHI CHEF washes their hands after they relieve themselves??!!  The hands they will use to prepare and serve your food???!!!! This is a health code violation!   I don't think the average diner is aware of an authentic Japanese dining experience. It definitely isn't at Osaka Japanese Bistro. We were disappointed to say the least.   1 star rating = half for service and half for sashimi!

-jUL2lvOSgDm8izw1FnZcg.text: My favorite sushi place! Tried some different good ones but none can compare to Osaka! Rudy is amazing & friendly & so are the rest of the servers! Love it!

The food always looks and taste fresh and amazing. The prices are always reasonable and you get the quality of high end food... I will make Osaka's a 2013 restaurant  for sure...   FYI, GET THE TEMPURA ICE CREAM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

mJVhN1vqDhiNjzMacvS54Q.text: Hamachi Sashimi - Perfect. Tender. Fresh.  Uni Sushi - Very fresh. Not too slimy. Melts in your mouth.  Asakusa Rolls - Spicy tina topped with albacore and scallions, tataki sauce on top - The spice level was good but it was missing that extra kick. The tuna was good..The roll just didn't have anything that stood out.  Osaka Rice - mixture of sushi rice, crab, masago, mayo, sesame oil, and sriracha - Sooooo much yumminess. It's like a comfort food more than anything else. Def try this.  I think it's best to stick with with the fresh sashimi and get some osaka rice to have a good meal.

V74mMcZbHDjq3kMKChIcLg.text: My favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. Best selection of fish that I have found.

_g0-6X14TC3ERP1n4Ijo1A.text: Walked into this restaurant the other night and, oh boy, they do they bring traditional seating back into style. Their luxurioius seating in the back that will make you take your shoes off to seat at a traditional japanese style seating tables brings you a bit of japanese tradition into your experience there. They have some of the best sushi rolls ive eaten so far in vegas. Will visit again soon. Great customer service.

sBbK3vDfz9eW31NzsCYeDQ.text: Probably the most unimpressive entrance to a surprise find in Las Vegas for traditional Japanese fare. Tempting menu options, made for hard decisions. Our selections did not disappoint.

aXBCz37OcyOwJ_eoeHzH1A.text: I went to an early dinner here with 2 coworkers. We walked in around 4:45 pm. The place was pretty dead and we even for a second thought that they were closed. Guess we were just early! We all ordered the shrimp & chicken off the teppan grill menu. The only seasoning I saw them put on the chicken, shrimp, rice & veggies was just salt, pepper and butter. I felt it needed more flavor. Something to set it apart from regular old chicken & shrimp. I feel like Geisha House gives their teppan meals more flavor than salt & pepper. Overall, portion sizes were good like they always should be. You leave full and satisfied. Our chef was awesome and nice. Our waiter was super nice and even chatted with us for a little. He wasn't awkward or antisocial. We had a good dinner.

_sZzUrqcJvk7IzKkLaLsyQ.text: Love this place!  Like what everyone is saying about the layout is kinda weird but still great ambiance, once you get to the Japanese seating area. And the place has plenty of seating even great for parties or dinner events.  Plus if you go on Groupon you get some kind of discount but I think its only for the anthem location.   Customer service is pretty good. They even gave us a little history about Osaka. How the owner was a great guy. He wanted to help people with no work so he opened a restaurant. There is a painting of him in the sushi bar. Also found out that they are NOT associated with the Lake Mead location.   The food is amazing! I mean your never gonna get it as fresh as Japan but taste is on point. Kinda brings me back to Japan.  It is a little pricey but totally worth it specially  on happy hour! I love love the tempura bam.  The curry is pretty good as well and is a big portion. And of course the sushi! I definitely recommend this place. It doesn't look much considering the location. But its a  MUST TRY!

i-N6Pb52P06R57dZxHDMow.text: My girlfriend and I ate here for dinner last night and it was nothing short of amazing.   We had a reservation for 8 but, with traffic on the east side, we made it around 8:15 and they still sat us right away around the Teppan bar. The young man got us our drinks speedy quick but still gave us time to look at the menu.   I got the Chicken and NY with the Calamari Steak appetizer and a 911(spicy, spicy tuna) roll and half a California. While my girlfriend got the Chicken and Shrimp and Calamari Steak as well. It was about 3 minutes from when he left our table that we had already gotten our soup and salad, delicious.   When our chef came out, he seemed quiet at first but then really started interacting with my girlfriend and I as the night progressed. I won't get too much into his routine because I feel like that's something special everyone should see but it was very cool.   My steak and chicken were perfectly cooked along with the friend rice and the Calamari Steak, tasted very authentic. The Sushi was delicious, not too crazy but not too plain, I loved every bite.   Our tab came out to 112.28 after our $20 tip, not bad considering how much food we got and the amazing service. Came here for our birthday dinner and was fulfilled in every single way. We will come here again with an empty stomach and a big smile :)

y_nUiH8Y4f1LzXdzQmHi2A.text: Delicious, fresh seafood!  Outstanding service!  We came in on a Tuesday afternoon and did not have to wait to be seated to have sushi only.

kI5nUGGVuwY8W-61dEECLA.text: Osaka Japanese Bistro is the   When I moved to Vegas 6 years ago, I missed the sushi culture that I had experienced living on the central coast CA my whole life.  I found out about Osaka Japanese Bistro when a local friend brought me to Happy Hour and I fell in love the minute I walked in.  They remember me and know what I order each time I dine here and they have amazing lunch and late night dinner specials.  Also,  I love all of Osaka's specials they treat to their locals.  Free sake every day for Happy Hour 4:30-7:00pm, buy a T-shirt and receive a free large sake and wear it into Osaka each time you eat and receive a free large sake.  They are open everyday from 11-2am & Osaka even have a VIP card for returning customers who get 10% of their check placed on a voucher for your next party

LV8QKoIHtNztsIJEb0E_0w.text: Soooooooo disgusting didnt like food and it SMELLED like BATHROOM dont recomend this place

1ciao8RGGjhJ5S2fd8dJcQ.text: I don't usually write reviews for restaurants unless I am super compelled to. Which I am. Osaka Japanese Bistro is absolutely amazing! I ordered a salmon nigiri sushi and Tonkotsu. The cuts were delicious and high quality. The Tonkotsu still haunts my mouth. I was in Osaka, Japan last year and the authenticity of this place is very, very spot on. I highly recommend checking this place out.

TCCfBxpazdihnlxfY89NaA.text: Saw this was on Diners, Dives, and Drives. I frequent Vegas quite a bit, so, had to make a stop here! It was really good! Will definitely make a return back!

TNF2TZwHV6JLnoQaQufTnw.text: Best spicy adamame in town! The service and food are always consistent. I come here weekly and I don't get tired of it,happy hour is my favorite. Definetly one of my favorite sushi places.

vzllBmeUEQKQwfK01-HXZQ.text: This place rules, I visit it every time I visit vegas. It is a hole in the wall, sketchy strip mall location and feels like it used to be a bar or something with the weird hallway entrance. They are open late and have an awesome late night happy hour. The staff is excellent and the food is great. They will make sushi off menu and will do a very thinly sliced japanese tuna that no other place has been able to get right for me. I have tried other menu items and everything has been great, good portion size and value to go along with the great service and quality.

YXKj3MhqLPuUpiWXZkdHzQ.text: I'll start by saying that I am SUPER picky about sushi.   This place has a really cool ambiance, with traditional-style seating in the back which we loved. They had some great specials and a very extensive menu.   I got the california crunch rolls, dragon rolls, and seaweed salad, which is my go-to at any sushi place. The rolls were huge and so fresh and tasty.   As a group we shared mochi and the tempura bananas for dessert - all the desserts are HUGE (don't let the pictures fool you) and delicious.   Highly recommend!

tTmMT5WVVWaFX5sXVRTChg.text: Just got out from this place and decided to write a review. Why? Because I read so many reviews about their service being suck and I have to disagree!   It was 1PM and it wasn't too busy (I think there are 3 occupied tables, a family at tatami, and few people on sushi bar). We were greeted and asked whether we would like to sit on table or tatami. We chose tatami and so directed to back area.   All of the waitresses were very nice and helpful. In fact, when my husband ordered a Ten Zaru Soba (cold noodle) from their regular menu, the waiter informed us that the item also available in Lunch Specials menu and for the same price, we would get tempura (2 pieces of shrimp) on the side. I really appreciate this kind of gesture. Especially because of the last review I read when I stepped out of the car said that this place "WILL RIP YOU OFF"!   They also gave out our drinks then miso soups then our food promptly. We tried: - Oh Kamisama (tempura roll with spicy tuna on the top and spicy mayo sauce) ~ very good and fresh - Broiled Eel bento box ~ very good - Tonkatsu bento box ~ 'twas OK - Ten Zaru Soba (cold noodle) ~ pretty good according to husband  Food presentation was really good.  Waitresses keep checking if we were doing OK but in a non-annoying way. They just popped in and out; I think to make sure that we didn't have to go out from our tatami booth to get them.   So yeah, overall, my experience was a very good and enjoyable one.

a7Ng6HUpQwwHqFt8Xjs2Jg.text: Dang it. I really wanted to love this place.  But the truth is, the atmosphere was reeeally dark. Not in a cozy, intimate way, but dark and depressing.  Our food was just so-so.  We ordered soup, salad, two types of sushi, edamame, white rice, and okonomiyaki.  Unfortunately, the food lacked fresh ingredients and was mostly very bland.  Our server, Haru-tan (?), an ex-pat from Japan was WONDERFUL and friendly.  But sadly, we would not return to this place.  Phooey.

jZVzXKC5KSl_xOBDfxsUuA.text: Honestly a pretty average Japanese restaurant. Vegas has some great chocked when it comes to this cuisine, some offering outstanding quality while others with great deals and Happy Hours. We came after 10pm to take advantage of the late night menu here, but it was still pretty expensive for rolls. They came out extremely fast however, as if it was cooked in a race. Honestly it was too fast, like we ordered two rolls and less than 5 minutes later we were bested by them. And then our appetizer took a good 20 minutes. So their timing needs to be worked on. They also had hit sake for $5 for late night, but no cold sake which is always very interesting to me. All in all, the sushi was ok, the service was slow to take our order but extremely fast to produce (at least the sushi), and the venue was nicer inside than the area appears. But I would try another great Vegas sushi place instead unless this is simply next on your list.

_wFJt2SFJfovthW__roV0Q.text: Small place  Great food Chef was great  Sushi chef crafts great varieties  Very friendly staff.

W7m9JunCSjrLBaAeSsMdTA.text: The food was amazing. The sushi was so fresh and the rolls were so good. The spicy edamame was so good we ordered a second. The restaurant lay out was a little funky but that doesn't take away from how good the food is. Will be back!

iPGiTtpZdbUcmZy9yqydJQ.text: This is my favorite spot for sushi in Vegas. Staff is always super friendly. If you're looking for a good sushi spot in Vegas, trust me you wanna try this place.

nv5dS1dhKtJDWQJia8JeZA.text: We've been here a few times and Jared has always taken good care of us. Tonight everything was on point. Sashimi was nice and fresh, all the items from the kitchen was good. The sake of course made it a wonderful night with the family.
