9w0A6_uZiRU8l5f1aaJH1w.text: I love to eat teppanyaki here. I always order the scallops with fried rice with an extra fried rice. I ladle the ginger sauce and mustard sauce on my rice. I highly recommend it. They do deliver but they don't have a way to order just fried rice. I usually have to order something else then call the restaurant and tell them what I'm really wanting. They also charge me too much for sauces in a 4oz cup. Yet if I ordered same food in restaurant and ate there it would be free. This is why I only gave them 3 stars. The location on Lake Mead IS NOT owned by them. Please don't get the one on Sahara confused. Just look for the small lady liberty statue and you'll know you're there.

WvBl4lIZtyEknQL-6z-HDQ.text: Doing the Hibachi grill? Get the fried rice add on! Oh my gosh this was SO GOOD! Thank you. Tummies are full and happy. Nom nom nom.

Qiju36Bqq5hbq-FPc3Bmcg.text: Hands down the best sushi experience in town, the sushi is the shizznit and the atmosphere makes you feel like your in japan. Udon and miso soup is the best no one elses can compare. A bit on the pricer side but you get what you pay for

rHI500TnzEsi6OqkRitXvQ.text: I absolutely love this place. I have been going there for years and never had a bad experience. The staff is always very welcoming and friendly, and the food is never a disappointment. I would recommend this place for sure!

l6eijevzUq9O08cJrnlHhw.text: I'm pretty sure that the people who gave this place five stars are related to the owners and therefore get better portions and deals. While I can't say the food was bad it was a complete rip off...I paid 100 for two king and queen plates (celebratory dinner for my bfs bday) the plates consist of a lobster tail and filet mignon with grilled veggies.   The lobster was probably considered a midget given the tail size and the lobster meat had been removed and cut up and replaced in the tail where I'm sure we got smaller portions than what was initially in the tail. I mean the amount of lobster was so little I'm pretty sure they took one lobster tail cut it up cooked up and grabbed an empty tail to split it up in two portions.   Similarly when ordering they ask how you want your filet mignon cooked however it is a useless question because they cut it up in little pieces!!! I don't know about you but I don't need help cutting up my meat I'm not a five year old, needless to say the small chunks were all very well done and again it was a very small portion.   You would think that at the very least they wouldn't skimp on the mixed veggies since its not a high cost item but they must be on a small budget because it was not substantial. I guess they get bargain prices on rice because we got a ton of that even though neither of us eat rice.   The food didnt taste bad though and they had nice sauces to dip your minitature meat portions into. At the end we were both left hungry and ended up getting capriottis later that night (bomb sub place that I definitely recommend) and was left feeling robbed especially after getting a better tasting and filling meal for like a quarter of the price.   Definitely not a good place to go unless your super rich and therefore don't mind getting ripped off. That's what I get for trying to avoid the fancy restaurants on the strip to get a good deal.

NlvBrF4zsT0oElAmS88kGg.text: Great food!  I meet a client there every month.  Its one of my favorite places to eat here in Las Vegas.  Ramon is so delicious if your in to Japanese food.

A18UIYRxWRV1QLXpnKlXFQ.text: On a recent trip to Vegas we hit this place up on Valentines Day for dinner. We called ahead of time and they gave us one of the sunken tables, and we were on our way! Walking in is disconcerting seeing a plain door, then a blank wall to walk around into the actual restaurant. I loved the sunken tables, I loved the traditional aspect of removing your shoes to dine, and the service was superb despite it being a holiday.  The food was great. GREAT. I had an order of pan-fried gyoza, tried the seaweed salad YUM! I ordered a half order of Tekka Maki, half order of a philly roll to play it safe, and tried the 777 roll to be adventurous. I was not disappointed!!! It did take a couple times of my asking to get my beer, but it was absolutely SLAMMED and the poor waitress was attentive but obviously frazzled and very busy.  They get 4 stars instead of 5 because despite us writing down our names and the dollar mount to charge on our split check, I ended up being charged someone's else's tab so my $30 meal is currently costing me $100 in "pending" authorizations. An inconvenience, but mistakes happen.

KjoONmx2Qi7JGwkmoBSWEQ.text: We sat at the teppanyaki table for dinner tonight and it was great. I had the fillet and chicken. The food was top notch and the chef put in a great show while cooking. I also liked that the table was smaller then other places i have been, it made for easier conversation. I highly recommend Osaka!

cqxnk_-9SU94LwLuQWU0lA.text: Ohhh I got the regular badge from here :-) That excited me.  This place is really good. I'm a sushi aficionado. I try to visit as many high rated local places in town. Frankly Osaka is REALLY far from my house but it's close to my surgeon's office. So where did we go for lunch after my two post op appointments?   ... You got it!  They give you the option of Teppanyaki, Sushi bar or the traditional Japanese seating on the floor with big fun fluffy pillows!  I love their lunch menu. They offer low priced high quality half rolls. We ordered a bunch!   007 Roll - $8.95 Shrimp tempura roll topped with spicy tuna  Citrus Lemon Salmon - $6.50 Salmon with lemon and salt  We ordered a few more with unusual names but they were all amazing and fresh. They also have an amazing Saki selection:  Nagasaki Mandarin Infused - $22.00/btl Ginjo Ty Ku - $13.00/gl, $48/btl Tozai "Living Jewel" Unfiltered - $15.00/btl Daiginjo Ultra Premium Horim - $26.00/btl Daiginjo Ultra Premium Hakatsuru - $12.00/gl, $46.00/btl Otokoyama Junmai - $11.00/gl, $20.00/btl Momokawa Genshu "G-Joy" - $18.00/btl Nigori Murai - $12.00/gl, $46.00/btl Nigori Tozai - $15.00/btl  We will be returning!

3Wm5PI6Y0Y00AQUmBF-sIg.text: Tuesday's has two for one appetizers. Go for the mussels, nachos, tuna, Brussels sprouts, and the halibut tacos.

t-4APMOPmYTQR1H6CVPcjA.text: Food is usually delicious, but sometimes the miso soup is watery & bland. Main reason for the 3 star rating is that the restaurant decor is in bad need of a renovation. It's old, outdated and doesn't reflect greatly the quality food. My wife complains of a smell in the resturant. I smell it too, but I think its the tanks gir the live seafood. It wouldnt hurt to vent that smell outside the dining area, it isn't appetizing. Now the mens bathroom is similar to dirty roadside gas stations, that's not cleaned as if your own family/young children were using it daily. That usually steers me right away from any resturant, but the food has been quality & I've watched the sushi chefs like a hawk while seated at the bar in front of them. They are clean & good at their craft. I'd go more often if they'd invest a little to freshen up the whole "little" resturant. It wouldn't take much.

1IPrX7qRYZDqrLchFxf3wQ.text: Always love coming here for real, traditional Japanese food. Osaka keeps an authentic menu, prepared to perfection, which is getting harder to find with all of these fusion-type Asian restaurants sprouting up. While that's alright sometimes, when I want an authentic Japanese dish made right, I come here. Love the ambiance & the staff is very friendly also.

rV09WyZrLaqB-6KUsaajSA.text: The best sushi I have had in a while. From the service to the food was a great experience!

wzQWV1GDS_uWeCFV4GrybQ.text: Okay, first off this place is my go-to sushi restaurant. I absolutely love this place, but today just wasn't that day. We walked in got seated with no probably, if you ever been to Osaka there are these tatami rooms and there is this one table where you are in a corner and there is a wall where nobody can see you and so unfortunately we got seated there. We sat down and usually you get water within the minute you've been there but no, we didn't cuz we were in the corner. 10 minutes pass by and still no water... nobody has yet acknowledged that we are there. So I stepped out and physically walked to an employee and asked can we please get a waiter and she said yeah yeah of course, so I sat back down and again waited another 10 minutes... so no water or anything. So we decided to just leave and go somewhere else. When we walked out no one even notice that we were leaving, they were too busy talking! & did I tell you that there were no business, there were only 3 tables so they weren't even busy! I'm not gonna say don't come here because I absolutely love this place. Maybe they were just having a rough day.

k1ZYkXgEFGXm--RVrHC9aA.text: I  didn't splurge on any of the specialty rolls but the rolls I got were cheap and delicious.

Q9w8BdwN2BdGbOI2xHA0HQ.text: Came in a couple nights ago at like 1am which was great, some of the best sushi ive had in along time. Thanks!

xYGAHeFior-pg_H_kwRnaQ.text: Let me start by saying I never write reviews. Ever. Last night we had reservations for a party of 14 at 8 p.m. our server was very nice. But drinks took 30 minutes. We didn't even see the chef until 9:40. Only 1 chef was on staff. So part of our party was left out of the experience. With his back to them. We finally get to eat around 10 pm. Mid meal the chef comes out with soapy water to start cleaning the grill. We asked if he could wait until we were done eating. He replied with "but I'm done now". And continued to clean we asked again that he please wait until we were finished eating, he actually told one of us "you shut up". But stopped cleaning.he then said again "but I'm done it's after closing" we would have gladly eaten before 10 if it hasn't taken 2 hours to get our food. We then asked for a manager, we were told the manager is off for the holiday. Our server was polite. But it was apparent that staffing was an issue if the manager wasn't even there. It's not fair to your guests to receive this type of service. Nor is it fair to your wait staff who should be able to enjoy their jobs. Another server helped with our checks, so the team work was apparent. But the chef who gave us dirty looks as he stomped off and the lack of management was a huge let down for out party celebrating a birthday. Abd I'm only giving 1 star because it doesn't allow us to leave zero stars. Again, our server was polite, nice and sweet. But he lacked the support that he needed in terns of a chef and a manager.

mPJWg8JxBRH_FmoqTw2PPw.text: Amazing food! Can't stop talking about it!! Will definitely go back next time we're in Las Vegas.

R_C1Ntuh8eHqA01AwAGK9Q.text: Mixed feelings about this place.  The building is kinda weird.  You walk in through he sushi bar room to get to the hostess station.  So, if you're sitting in the sushi bar room, which is small, everyone walks by you.  The room had adequate lighting but looked aged.  There is a breeze coming from the vents that would blow for a while and then stop and start and stop.   Appetizers we got gyoza, kalbi sticks, spring rolls.  We did not like any of the appetizers.  Kalbi didn't have any carmelization and lacked the flavor I expect.  Spring rolls where real small and didn't have much filling.  gyoza were small with a thin shell and appeared to be deep fried, so there were crispy all around.  We're used to them being fried on one side and steamed on one side.    We got a roll sampler that had spicy tuna, las vegas roll, cal roll and a shrimp tempura roll.  Rolls were meh, just okay.  Don't think I would order those again.    Then we ordered salmon, yellowtail, and smoked salmon nigiri along with a futomaki roll.  The nigiri was good.  The futomaki roll appeared to have been refrigerated.  Seaweed was a little hard and the rice was cold.    I think if we only got nigiri, this place could have been a 4 star, but with what we got, 2 stars is about all I can give

VEsMj7tZV2r55ubRabXDJw.text: Food was good, but after the meal were told only cards with chips are taken. My bank doesn't have a chip and I was told to go to a cash machine. The managers solution was not acceptable and a self printed sign adjacent to the entry door is not acceptable! David the manager was unprofessional and unable to handle the situation. His response was childish and has made a loyal customer of over six years decide to never return! A negative star is appropriate for the actions of the manager alone!

D1AfMfEY6PCO907V43uljA.text: I always pass this place and very committed to my sushi bars. BUT this place blew me away and this place is amazing I am definitely coming back thank you Osaka !!!

TZWIRk4c4sKw9n0y5tYZyA.text: I'd give 1/2 star, but Yelp doesn't allow that. Just finished eating here for lunch...did you know they import bugs from a farm?! We didn't either until there was a bug affixed to my chop stick. Asked for the manager, that was a struggle too...finally got to talk to the owner Gene who informed us the bug must have come from the farm. No sorry, just information of where the bug used to reside. So if you are up for a little excitement in your dining experience, try the salad and ask for extra imported bugs.

xqP6U2aojrFu22HQYisf5w.text: Love this place! I've never tried anything I didn't like here. They have lunch and late night specials. I go about once a week and enjoy the Japanese tatami style tables. The employees are all very kind and attentive as well!

DWZM1zN1NJREQiIiI9yXSw.text: They wouldn't give my daughter a place at our table.  My husband, almost 1 year old daughter, and I went to eat dinner at the teppanyaki table.  We got there at about 5:20, without a reservation.  The hostess went to seat someone else and so my husband went to use the restroom.  The manager came over and asked if I'd been helped.  I said no and that there were three of us.  She said she had to wait until we were all here to seat us.  I said my husband was in the restroom.  She refused to seat us until he got done.  This already put a bad taste in our mouths.  Next, they seated us at the short end of the table with my daughter's highchair not at the table as the rest of the table was occupied.  We noted another grill across from us with only 4 people who had just been seated.  We asked our waitress if we could be moved so that my daughter could be at the table with us since she doesn't have the ability to eat in her lap.  The waitress said she'd ask if that was okay.  The manager said no as those spots were reserved.  We said we're going to go ahead and leave since our daughter needs a place to eat and she said "okay, bye".   The only redeeming part of the evening was, once the other customers at our table realized the situation, they all moved down and made room for my daughter (even though it meant everyone was squished).  They were so nice we ended up staying and eating our "just okay" dinner (it's been a while but we remembered the food as being much better in the past).  The "people" who reserved the other seats at the table across from us never showed.    This used to be one of our favorite nights out, pre-baby, however the lack of accommodation means it's not a place we'll go to in the future.

7USZb5SP7ue8FwW0dthNvw.text: I normally stop by Osaka on my way home from work to get soup and a small appetizer but I happened to be off for the evening. I placed my order for pick up and as I pulled into the lot a lady was sitting on the curb approached me.   She was someone who probably doesn't get a meal as frequently as most and quietly asked me if I could give her my leftovers after dinner and didn't want any money.   I went into the restaurant to get my soup and half of a sushi roll and asked the server if I could leave money for the lady outside so she could pick her meal and actually be able to sit down and eat it. A bald man who was another server chimed in and was like no you can't do that, she'll bother other customers, that's what they usually do. It's better if you get her something to go.   I will not be returning to Osaka. That man had no humanity or compassion in him. If that's the type of people that work there, my business is not needed. A real sit down meal was all I wanted to provide for someone. Whoever that server was should be ashamed. If you can't help humankind there is no hope.

wBGEJuBvBk7bqq-Hfq3AFA.text: I give this place 3.5 stars. The only time I have really come here is late night during happy hour. Not sure if I would come in during non-happy hour. I usually order sushi rolls, and maybe their sake sampler or just water. I like their Tatami rooms but the place is older and activity in the surrounding area can feel sketchy. I double check my car and make sure I don't have any items of valuable visible from the outside to tempt some passerby from possibly breaking in. The restaurant itself is borderline dive status but the staff is nice and friendly. Although I did seem to almost get into a debate with one of the servers, one time, over the correct pronunciation of lychee. Whenever I would say, "lie-chee" he would respond back saying, "lee-chee". I'm sure he pronounces tomatoe as "toe-mah-toe," but I digress.  Never had an issue with the place being super busy. They have a Teppanyaki grill area but I have never tried it so I cannot give an opinion. The food is decent and their prices are more or so on par with many of the other sushi places here in town. Maybe a couple items priced higher than other places I have been to. I am a repeat customer and will stop by again if it's during happy hour and I happen to be in the area.

8mdPaHTYsdmZdWi_gc1Jkg.text: Excellent Sushi. Like that you can get 1/2 rolls or full rolls. For 2 of us the bill cam to over $90.00 this included 1 small sake & a beer plus green tea tempura ice cream.

6JudHHqQ70RgPIlkEJwXzw.text: What a great place for a tapanyaki nights! The food is amazing. I couldn't stop complimenting through out the entire dinner course!

Rv4ly1O6z0r8-l8csdJsXA.text: I came here when evening with my family and we did to her Baci Grill my son had such a nice time I had the lobster and the scallops everything was traditional everything was fine we sat with some good people it's a little bit hard to find unless you have your navigator on because you will drive right past it I've done it twice Don't forget that if you come at an odd time you might have to wait for seating so that they have a Knouff to start their presentation but they do the traditional volcano and anything that you would get any hibachi restaurant They do have a full bar It's been around for years so I don't know why anyone would give it a bad review

q5WavCoVGK6JJirxczL31g.text: Worst sushi ever. For the owner - Please step up and do better. It's shame to serve such a good traditional food in  very poorly way.

PZyM38VOTX39GBI6aDsyZA.text: We visited Osaka on the night before Thanksgiving as a part of our Vegas foodie vacation, based on their feature on Triple D.   Literally the best sushi we've ever had!    I have a weird self-imposed rule about eating fish so far from the ocean.  (Which I know is ridiculous - even living in San Diego, I know most of our seafood is not locally sourced!).  I broke my rule at Osaka, and I'm so very glad I did!  We decided to sit in a traditional Japanese booth, and were seated quickly, and our server was very attentive through our whole dinner.   The portions were generous and very reasonably priced.   Plus they allow you to order half rolls, so you can try lots of different combos!    We ordered the Osaka rice and several rolls...  Absolutely, hands down the Japanese Lasagna roll was one of the best bites of food I've ever had.  Not at all traditional, but so delicious with melted cream cheese on top...  I'll be dreaming about that roll for a while!   We also ordered the Roppongi, Oh Kamisama and Treasure Island at the recommendation of our server.  They were his favorites, and we really enjoyed them.   Then we went a little wild and ordered the Yum Yum, Pocket Aces, Fresh White, And Kai's Special.   We decided that the Fresh White was a little bland, but still better than any of the sushi we've had in California.     Overall, this was an outstanding experience and I'm glad we ventured off strip to try it.   Next time we'll likely sit at the grill, because all of the fish was so fresh and delicious, I have no doubt that the Kobe on the teppan grill is to die for!!

I'm picky with Japanese food because I'm from Gardena, CA, where the old school Japanese live and where the best Japanese food is served in Los Angeles.  Osaka Bistro is one of the best I've been. Oh, I don't know the owner but he was so Nice! Guys try this place next time you go to Vegas!

NW4cCPh9i9c68aXYHf4QuQ.text: Osaka is hands down the best Japanese restaurant in the Las Vegas area. I always try to leave The Strip to get a more mellow, authentic experience and this place is my first pick. Fresh sushi, a large menu, great service, fair pricing and tasty specials all make this place the go-to when in Vegas.

wUm5ZrMoTXaOTj85vFwcZg.text: Osaka has some of the best sushi in town. It's always fresh, and the prices are reasonable--particularly on the late-night happy hour menu, which runs from 10 to 2.  Last night, we had an early dinner at the sushi bar. (You can also sit at tables in the small front restaurant or dine at the teppan grill in the back, but we always come just for sushi, so we prefer to sit in front of the chefs.) As usual, we ordered a full rainbow roll and a half dragon. And to change it up, we tried two half rolls that we had never ordered before: the fresh white (albacore and hamachi topped with a tangy sauce); and the Treasure Island (salmon, hamachi, and capers--like a Japanese take on a bagel and lox). Both were fine, although the TI was a little tart because it was topped with a thin lemon slice. We much preferred our usual fare; you can't go wrong with fresh fish and eel.  We also split an order of the spicy garlic edamame, upon a friend's suggestion. Meh. And I got a large Sapporo beer. Yum! This feast cost just over $50, and it was pretty tasty. My only issue with the meal was that the rolls weren't rolled tightly enough, so they kept falling apart. Not a game changer, but still ...  Osaka was recently featured on "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives," so we were expecting it to be full of tourists. Thankfully, it wasn't. Lots of locals, and the same low-key atmosphere that we've grown to expect.  There are several Osakas in town, but this is the best--especially if you're a fan of rainbows and dragons!

Qj-QE9VqPVjMyzxNyDWq7Q.text: Food was okay. Grilled salmon was good. Yakitori portion was small and overcooked, meat was too tough and dry.  One thing we laughed so hard was that there was a menu saying "kintama udon" in Japanese writing. Do you know what that means? "BALLS UDON" yes, the balls!! Men's testicles!! LOL I've never heard such thing in my life! I wonder if they knew it when they created their menu. Lol We were laughing so hard that the waiter guy asked us if we are okay lol then we explained about the kintama udon thing and he said "oh yeah, every Japanese customer laughs" oh man I died that day.

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where I marked w/ red...it says きんたまうどん meaning &#34;balls udon&#34;, yes testicles udon! It says Udon w/egg n fried tofu but why balls?
Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kitsune soba, yakitori, grilled salmon and rolls.

KPHl0-WpkMG2wBkL64_icg.text: Osaka's Bistro was okay. I have definitely experienced better. I thought being an older establishment it would be better. Businesses do not stay around 30+ years if they are bad.   I would say the food was average for Teppanyaki. There was nothing fantastic about it. The facility is incredibly small, OLD, and definietly seen better days. I thought the private rooms were probably the best part, however, I did not dine in one.   There was only one bathroom, and it was not exactly clean. The bar was small, drinks were overpriced and the sushi was so-so. Overall it was an average experience, with average food, average service and an expensive price tag. we paid $160.00 for four people. I will not be going again.

B9LEdReqVin6Elektr5f7g.text: We found out about Osaka from friends who had been here a few months earlier.  They highly recommended this "First Japanese Restaurant " in Las Vegas.  We were equally impressed.  Not only was our entire meal delicious, the service was impeccable.  Would love to be a regular here.

EzkJUGwnvWwvOHAYvI459g.text: My friend and I come here all the time for their late night happy hour. The staff is phenomenal, as well as the food. Always fresh and service is quick! I must say though, we have been loyal customers because of how AMAZING Rudy is! We love him.

The staff are really nice and attentive. The chefs attention to detail in both presentation and flavor is what truly sets this place apart from the rest.

55Qwah5Yru2nMkfB5h_U2w.text: Love love love everything. Sake, food, service  Taking shoes off and seating on pillows gives me the whole oriental experience.   Great late night menu as well.

HpITMtTvlYYVCoryA7Bl4A.text: It is in a strip mall and it is not ritzy, but the food..is so killer. The price is reasonable. Take people like your family to this place. Nothing fancy. Drink some tea, get a ramen or teishoku and eat some good food. Go to this place if you want good Japanese food. The owner and cooks are Japanese so it is authentic. Go to Japan if you want better Japanese comfort food. I cannot believe a place like this exists in Las Vegas!! Everytime I go to Vegas, I go to this place. I ordered the Tempura and katsu, last time I went.  It was crispy and full of flavor.

dwXgiBPELgGo2K5qNzQYwg.text: This place is extremely cute! It was our first time there and we were seated at a "booth." It's the kind of place where you take off your shoes and eat. It made me feel like I was at a real restaurant in Japan. They're opened until 2 AM so my boyfriend and I came for their happy hour. They have a huge selection and we ordered a few rolls. Just FYI the happy hour rolls are smaller than their regular rolls. It was tasty and the food was fresh.

2yyMXQ2vBIrnME8RfJ7GeA.text: As we walked in, we thought the seating area was small but were seated immediately.  But, we found out later, they have two hibachi-style tables and many tatami mat tables as you go further into the restaurant.  Food was okay, nothing special.  Service was unimpressive.  Waiter did not engage, no expression or enthusiasm or suggestions  as we asked about the menu items.  As diners, we did not feel that welcomed. As we paid and as we left, there was nothing said by any of the workers.  I guess they don't really appreciate patronage.  Wouldn't bother coming back.

xDgMCd2_nKsT7IfBZ2524g.text: Japanese lasagna sushi..one word. Heaven!! The best I've ever had and no where else makes it the same believe me I always compare..it must be the sauce. Also a great place for late night sushi. Occasionally they play live music on a piano and it's a very atmosphere. Always suggest this place whenever anyone wants sushi but it's slightly pricey that's the only thing. Its quality and great service which I think is so worth it. Kid friendly but even more enjoyable on a date night.  Enjoy!

2wNeOg4pmIn8-tMHz5oVzA.text: I am not a sushi expert by any means, but last night,  I got to experience a wonderful dinner there with a friend who is. Everything I had; pot stickers, the 777 roll, and tasting my friends sashimi style everything , omg! The atmosphere was casual and fun. The service was  awesome too! Huge selection on the menu, hard to pick when your a novice, and the saki was devine. I look forward to going back there soon!

Ri1ybIwPwNWfAFKZkk_Hlw.text: I don't know if i would come back here. So here is the review.   My boyfriend and I went to Osaka to try out their late night menu.   $11 for 6 piece sashimi, $7 for some of their half rolls, $22 for fresh scallop (not part of late night menu). Wanted to get the fresh Uni, but they sold out. Got the wings, Gyu Maki and shrimp shumai as appetizers.  Everything just seemed off. First of all the quality of the fish was not great. Really thin pieces, and almost dry. Got a white tiger roll, it was okay, like the Bonzai sauce, but everything else was just really plain. Fried wings were bland and just looked sad accompanied with raw broccoli and dry carrots.  No music was playing so it got really awkward cuz the sushi chefs were just busy making orders and they didn't even make eye contact with us. If it wasn't for the TV behind the bar we don't know if we would be able sit through our meal.  In the end, we just ate really quick and left. Like I said before, don't know if I would revisit again, maybe if they spruce up the atmosphere a little bit and get better quality of food.

5xUZa_9PdNvZmNSwEXJxXw.text: This place is filthy. We are sitting in the back at a booth and the space next to the wall is an inch thick in dirt. The place in general in unkempt.  The food was fair but 4 rolls and they all tasted the same.

Nb7noHRCS4bD6GPtWegCRA.text: I've been a fan of Osaka for awhile. They've been around for awhile. They're a steady sushi spot. They've thrown in some new items as they've aged. The "bistro" part was only recently added, at least to my recollection they were once only known as Osaka. The restaurant, although in a seedy part of town, has been kept up well. I'm sure at some point in time, this spot was a GOOD spot in town. But you can't really help what happens to an aging city. You can help keeping your restaurant clean and nice looking, which Osaka has done.  I enjoy the atmosphere of Osaka, it is dimly lit when you first walk in and around the tepanyaki areas. However, the dining area is well lit with nice, clean, wooden tables. The service has always been up to par when I have visited. The servers are well versed on the menu, they are around consistently to refill drinks (I usually always order a hot green tea).   On my last visit I went with a friend because I had a LivingSocial deal, which they honored without any hesitation. I had a few different items: Age Dashi Tofu. I thought it was pretty good, although I have had a better age dashi tofu at Cafe de Japon. The serving they give at Osaka is quite large. I shared some with my friend. The broth it was in was a teeny bit salty for me, but I did drink it all up. Moving on to sushi, because that's what I came for. I ordered the Lisa Lisa roll (shrimp tempura, cream cheese, avocado, eel sauce). It was decent. Not the best or worst roll I've ever had. The tempura was on the soggy side. Wish it had had a more crispness to it. Next: temaki (hand roll). I always get a hand roll when I eat sushi. I ordered the Miki's special, it's simple: crab, massago, and mayo. It was good. And lastly: nigiri. I ordered the sweet shrimp (Ama Ebi). This was my favorite by far. I wish I had just ordered a bunch of these. They were stuffed full, very generous portions.   My friend also allowed me to try some of the food she got. I unfortunately cannot remember what it was she ordered. But one thing was the Japanese pancake, which I really liked because it had seafood in it.   We ended our meal with the Bomba - chocolate peanut butter! I highly recommend this. It was very good.   Overall I like Osaka. I will be back again. They have a very extensive menu and I would like to try more sushi as well as their Udon.

L02rOo83RNuU23ET_T4whw.text: Their food is amazing. The tatami rooms are just add ons to the whole dining experience.  The unagi bowl is WORTH IT. A little pricy but all sushi places are. If you get tired of buffet, definitely try this place.

AyRSFp5aQlRa10GVqvnCVg.text: Loved it,small intimate, food very good, desert nummy!

ntSXtgJ2djFu523Jg0YTlw.text: If you want fresh, you want Osaka.  Great late night specials too

nQvUUjs1v-vfOPU5q4Lr_A.text: My top choice for sushi in Vegas.  I've visited 2 locations in Vegas, but the Henderson location feels like home.  They are quick to learn your name and the staff couldn't be any nicer!  Try the 777 Roll!

ZK9H6gEtN9cpoUiIaAomig.text: Eh ...  Okay, I'll start with the good:  The ambiance and service was great.  They have those low tables, where you take your shoes off and/or sit cross-legged.  Our server was very friendly and hospitable.  The so-so: The food was okay.  I had tempura vegetable Udon soup and a side of vegetable rolls.  The tempura vegetable was good.  The Udon soup and vegetable rolls were okay.  The BF had curry rice.  I tasted the curry, and it was good.  The BF said the chicken was pretty good.  His Sister had Soba noodles.  I'm not a big fan of these noodles, but it she appeared to enjoy it.  I also had a melon soda, which was really good!  It has a marble in the drink, which is entertaining for little kids.  The bad:  The price was a little steep for an average Japanese restaurant.  It came out to $30 a person.  The pitcher of beer also has a large cone in the middle of it so that you don't get as much beer as you think you're getting.  Helpful hint:  They have a point card for those frequent patrons.  Overall, I wouldn't object to going here again, but it's not my first choice.

_UOgtiKG-LOqbJhHn7qjzQ.text: Great quality food! The staff is helpful and knowledgable lots of sushi options and non sushi. I visit on a regular basis Osaka has never once disappointed!

4iSC9bRQ08YseNA9dGTvdw.text: Sushi was great, I had the Bonzai, the sauce was amazing, however the staff was a bit standoffish and the tea was terrible, I've also never been charged for tea before, so that was new, other than that i really liked it. I might go back, if only for the amazing Bomba dessert i got,

rZNUvM9HW8z0b6xNhmKz8Q.text: The food was excellent. We got food from the grill and it was the best I've had in a long time. The restaurant is small and fills up so I would try to call and make a reservation if you want to get a seat during prime time.

YHbLXXo61r5roGs6NXlY8A.text: This is our go-to sushi spot in the city. We're usually going with a big group (10-20 people), and they've always been VERY accommodating. The sunken tables (tatami rooms?) with legroom underneath are great for big groups, allowing a little privacy, and the service is always pretty good. Good house sake, standard Japanese beers.  I wouldn't say it's the best sushi I've ever had, but it's up there enough to keep us coming back. And it's certainly been consistent in my experience.

NBIgbb6NIEenlnv0P_Hf4g.text: We've eaten here several times since my last post and everything has been really good. When we've eaten with the live chef, he's always been extra attentive to our 3yo son. The food is still a little expensive and I've stopped asking for brown rice because they charge so much for it. Otherwise, the food it good and the take out is prepared quickly and the location is convenient for us.

imLsksHiIuYY_GekuktyJA.text: Another must-eat during our Vegas culinary adventures.  Almost always accommodating (no wait) for this quiet haven of quality food!!  The soft shell crab appetizers are a winner and almost anything else will not disappoint!!

X-5htA8HI3g7diD9TrXukQ.text: After going on HGTV I decided to go there. The place got cleaned up more. I guess you could have a nice time. The menu has real cheap items. Not bad and has other seating if you ask.

sMXYa9Cn-KRC4tkjzny5pQ.text: We took a table in the Tatami Room. I would highly recommend sitting there instead of at a regular table. Where do I begin?? The menu is a notebook of options! There was a plethora of fish...from mackerel to tuna to salmon to shrimp. There were so many varieties. You can share this meal.   They make all of their own sauces. The eel sauce is amazing! U7EZ6Y1H9j60lcUL37QQwQ.text: If you've ever passed this place and thought that it was a busy bar filled with drunk people, you're wrong! That's one reason why I never came here to eat because I was totally under a misconception. In reality it is a beautiful old style Japanese restaurant. They serve high quality food, great drinks from sake to kona brewing company big wave beer. The sushi is fresh! The desert options are bountiful, the rice is cooked well. But most of all the staff is super amazing!!!! Like the best customer service you would ever find! They tend to your every need and make you feel so comfortable! There is a sushi bar area with some tables around that you can sit and dine. Then turn the corner and you are transformed into a whole Japanese feel with their cute tatami rooms. Basically you take your shoes off and kneel at your table or cross your legs. But if your feet start to get numb you can actullay put them down as there is a space for you to sit normal. I went here at 10pm and This place is so family friendly that there were families with their kids. They play soothing relaxing music. It's not loud at all in there. Everything is spaced out well enough to have privacy and not feel crowded. So I went in looking for some good misoyaki fish and they did not disappoint. I'm gonna cut to the chase, I ordered misoyaki chiliean sea bass, a bowl of rice, a bowl of miso soup, two pieces salmon nigir and two pieces of garlic tuna nigiri. I drank hot green tea and for dessert I had the chocolate lava cake with vanilla Ice cream. My bill came out to $44! IT WAS WORTH EVERY PENNY and I am most definitely coming back always!!!!! The food is amazing and they have an extensive late night menu which I will try ordering more food from next time. Did I mention the deserts? They have flan here! Can you believe it? They were all out but I will try it next time! The servers were probably the best part! Super wide smiles from ear to ear! Part of the reason why I'm surely coming back! Go try it! Sit in a tatami room! Have some sake! Try the misoyaki sea bass, a bowl of rice and miso soup! You won't regret it!

sA2E1shUWeaaNlqXpoE-hA.text: After seeing so many negative reviews lately, I was hesitant about having a dinner there with my fiance. It was a special night for us, we had a Sunday reservation at 8:30pm. The moment I walked in, the gentleman who greeted us was the sweetest and most friendly host ever! We were promptly seated and the waitress served our drinks, she was so nice and gave great ideas for drinks. We had hibachi, I can't remember the chefs name but I know we hat Batman tattoos and a Batman belt, so I'll call him Batman. Let me tell you, Batman made the experience! He was so nice and funny! He engaged everyone at the table (us and a family) he was amazing! The food was beyond delicious and we had such large portions! Seriously if you go, ask for Batman!! We decided this will be our place to go for special date nights! Everyone was friendly and accommodating even with our Groupon!

0jWjN_OreCs2u0HbnHeFmw.text: Osaka has been a long standing Japanese Restaurant in the valley...I can only say it was Ok for me.  It's been many years since my last visit to Osaka Japanese Bistro on Sahara, but on this windy night, I came here with my girl friend in preparation for her upcoming trip to Osaka, Japan, as she wanted to try Okonomi Yaki.    Also we ordered  - Tako Wasabi - Chirashi  - Tokujo Nigiri: 12 pcs of nigiri Chef's choice   My favorite was Tako Wasabi...fresh and crunchy. The Chirashi had so much rice in the bowl, but was also packed with fresh cuts of fish which we enjoyed...unlike the nigiri, that seemed to all be dry and bland.  Service was excellent...they never stop filling our cups with hot tea and water.    Unfortunately for Osaka Japanese Bistro, Vegas has so much competition for sushi lovers, and Osaka stands as just average for me.  -2017 review #30-

sANkKYl4d6PzqNzoEMmTHw.text: We've been coming here for many years-in the 15 years we lived in Las Vegas and 9 years since we've left but returned to visit family. This review is a compilation of all our visits. Osaka is one of our favorite places especially as far as ambiance in LV.   We tend to go to dinner early so there are fewer people and we have the back to ourselves. The sushi bar and bar area gets pretty noisy during happy hour as does the teppanyaki room. So, going early has lots of benefits. We enjoy sitting at the sushi bar on occasion but my favorite is the quiet tatami rooms in the back. The tatami rooms are low tables and seats where you remove your shoes before heading down into a cozy space.   We are such creatures of habit when we do sushi. We always get a hot saki, a Kirin beer, miso soup and shrimp & veggie tempura. Then we change it up-though hubs often has a Chiarashi bowl so he gets lots of different things. They have updated the menu since we started and have a good variety of selections. Osaka does a really good Chiarashi. In fact, I think everything we've had is good.   The past few times we've been there has been with friends for a special occasion and they prefer the teppanyaki tables. We wouldn't go to the teppanyaki table on our own but it's it's nice to do the tables for a special occasion. We usually reserve the whole table and have even had to add a couple seats to fit everyone. They entertain the group though it makes chatting a bit more difficult except to the ones closest to you. We have had steak or shrimp which they cook nicely-despite all the activities on the cook top. The meat come with rice and veggies.  We do recommend Osaka. It is a wonderful place with a variety of areas in one restaurant to have a nice quiet dinner, a fun happy hour or special occasions.

Xlux4tZb4dHTsPt-4FCtTw.text: I've been here twice now and both times I've been so excited to eat that I forget to take pictures of the delicious food! I'm a huge katsudon fan and theirs is amazing! I always get a little bit of sushi and this time I got a half order of the ultimate Osaka and to me, it was worth the price! These guys are amazing at making sushi.  It's kind of in a sketchy looking area but don't be alarmed. The food is worth it. There's always a good amount of parking. There's actually a dentist office next door and we usually park there since we've come for dinner when they're closed.

The service is very attentive to your need & the sushi chefs are awesome. Atmosphere is very chill & relaxed. They have it all, delicious desserts, delicious everything! Definitely a Must try!!!

BYYEW2UfZjTyNz9UXEikbA.text: Sushi here is beyond awesome, on the other hand the service is beyond horrible!!!  I think I saw my server 2x.   After being sat at our table, our server came by after 15minutes.   Our food.... Took over 25 minutes to get soup... Then another 45 minutes to get sushi.... Half of our table got to eat.   The other half had to wait another 30 minutes to get their food.   Saw our waiter again for our bill. Like I said sushi was bomb, but the slow service totally blew it.  For the price we paid, it was not worth it. I definitely will not be back.

Y1diuMQFnDolFtZ6_OfQGQ.text: Osaka is, hands down, my favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas (and in the last 10 years, we have frequented quite a few). They have excellent fish (top quality, all the time), reasonable prices, and a smaller, quiet sushi bar that is very easy to enjoy a meal at with your family. They also have a dining room with tables, and tatami rooms in the back, where I would personally love to go for a birthday dinner. It's about 10-15 minutes off the strip, and in my opinion totally worth it whether you're a local or in town for vacation.   One of the best bonuses about Osaka is their hours- they are open for lunch and super late (until 2:00 am!!!).   Some ordering recommendations-  - My number one recommendation is simply for the nigiri sushi. I personally have never had a bad experience with their sake or hamachi, and when they say the uni is good, it's really good! I also like their regular-old spicy tuna roll.  - Our family's go-to rolls generally include the O.G. Special (crispy rice with spicy tuna and yummy sauce + sriracha on top) and Kai's Special roll. Both are always hits with visitors too.  - From the kitchen, I personally like the Osaka Rice (sushi rice, masago, crab, sauce). Our family is split between the empura soft shell crab with ponzu sauce and the soft shell katsu with screaming sauce- both are a great appetizer to split.

mg6LWvkHCQZcV5vTD8EGKg.text: BEST Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas.  The food and service is 5 Stars.  The servers (Mike and Jared) are very attentive and knowledgeable.   If your in Las Vegas give it try, you won't be disappointed.

rZhi1tYGQL5gpVlsjwMhFw.text: In Vegas for the first time and wanted to try something off the strip.. found this place loved it great service atmosphere and the employees were attentive and made you feel welcomed. Great food great price! Definitely a place to come back too

rGZtVl4J6c1jcXISP6jjYQ.text: WOW! After spending 6 years living in Japan and eating real Japanese food, this is THE closest we have come to it in the states! Food was cooked as ordered and the servings were plentiful and properly cut to size. Staff was super friendly and very attentive. Glass would go empty and BAM, it would be full. Menu was rather large with plenty of options and to satisfy even the pickiest appetite. Definitely worth visiting and next time we are in town I can guarantee you we will be going back! This reminded me of a small place we frequented weekly in Japan and brought back a lot of great memories with our Japanese friends. Oh and those of you who have been stationed on Okinawa, they have ORION!

mBcyZExDyEI5hhLriliSxQ.text: I've heard so many great things about Osaka Japanese Bistro so of course the hubby and I had to try it when we were in Las Vegas last week.  Both him and I love sushi so we had high expectations going in here.  We chose to dine in one of their tatami rooms since we really wanted to experience the authentic Japanese style of dining.  The tatami rooms do provide somewhat a feeling of intimacy and privacy so it was a nice change.  We ordered their sashimi platter (ahi tuna, yellow tail tuna, salmon, albacore), kim chee, miso soup (perfect blend of sweet and salty), a kamikaze roll (eel roll with sweet sauce), spider roll (deep fried soft shell crab roll with sprouts), white tiger (tuna roll flame cooked on top with a white sauce), tuna-poki (our favorite of all dishes, the slices were super thin and fresh, tossed in a light sesame oil dressing with sweet thin slices of seaweed), and a Nigori sake sampler (apple, strawberry, and lychee flavor - our favorite).    We were pleasantly surprised that everything tasted so fresh and all the dishes came out fast.  Prices were not too bad considering we were in Las Vegas.  We spent a total of $130 total for all our dishes including drinks and tip so not bad for a really good sushi joint.  Would definitely love to come back here when we're in town again.

8dHJ_kXegOVg2y5y7OQ6Ow.text: Loved it!!!!  Saw it on DDD and it was well worth the trip off the strip.  We had the Roppongi, Oh Kamisama, and White Tiger rolls.  We also had the Blue Fin Tuna, Skipjack, Thai Hamachi and Special Tai nigiri.  Everything was amazing and super fresh!  We will definitely be back!

RvXC9ZhoNyYnHq0BegJI4g.text: This place is so delicious! I am a regular & most of the time they all ready know my order, their spicy edamame is to die for. Their service is also great. I enjoy this place a lot, highly recommend it.

pK09ELYlXh6_YNH9Wr5Jag.text: Well, I must say I was quite hesitant when we saw the place. It is in a cheap strip mall surrounded by 'exotic' shoe and dance wear stores. Very unassuming decor and a very small seating area..but.......The food is amazing!! I have not had sushi this good in a very, very long time.Tough to get fresh fish in Vegas but this place manages to deliver an amazing meal. Enjoyed watching Chef make our rolls. Sadly the reason for the 4 stars: The servers were sloooooow. It took a long time for them to bring our  drinks and refills. Thankfully we sat at the sushi bar so were served our food immediately from Chef. I will go again.

4GFPQp1belvyHfITj1fXSg.text: This is a review of catering, which I hired for a party at my house about a month ago. I wasn't sure what to order but I knew I wanted sushi/japanese. They brought a large sushi boat, veggie tempura, salad, fried rice, edamame, salad and all the sides stuff like ginger, wasabi, and sauces. They even brought an extra side platter of vegetable sushi for the vegetarians/people with allergies. It was so yummy, gorgeous, and although the sushi lasted pretty much for the duration of the party there were only a few pieces left at the end. Everyone loved it. The price was very reasonable too. I highly recommend them if you want sushi at your party.

Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. catering for our party

SrOxOM4juZllTgB--GzfeA.text: I took my family here with my partner on Black Friday (his birthday) for lunch.  Not a single thing was out of place.  I give one solid star for service (I would give two stars but this only goes up to five and I need the other stars for the rest).  Our waiter was on top of it, full of humor and personality, and when we were too full to order dessert, he still brought us out a triad of ice cream to share with spoons and a candle as a birthday treat for my partner.   One star for the atmosphere.  The music isn't too loud, there are tatami rooms with ample room, and the decor is very simple and late traditional.  One star for the price and portion sizes.  We were very happy with the lunch prices, the bento box had plenty of food (I couldn't finish my rice), and there is Asahi on draft, which I highly recommend over the bottled.  Two stars for the food and the fact that I will most definitely be coming back!  We got both types of oyster appetizers that are raw, and it was a tie for which tasted best between the four of us.  But all were delicious.  I had the grilled saba in my bento.  The portion looked small and not like much, but the flavor and texture were a wonderful delight and I did not encounter a single bone, which never happens with saba!  The tempura was lightly battered and the vegetables were fitting (sweet potato and carrot, etc).  Everyone loved the house made salad dressing.  It was light and refreshing, as was the seaweed salad I had with my bento.  I ordered tonkatsu for my partner and it was of a great texture and not too thick, or too thin and dry.  It was very light in texture and fried to a perfect golden brown throughout.  The soup appetizer was not miso, but more a teppanyaki restaurant soup more predominant with broth, but was surprising to have a small amount of noodles in it, which we were all pleased with.   Osaka, thank you very much for a wonderful time while my family was here on my partner's birthday!!!  ^_^

ckD8au-C3yD7GBOOSoylvg.text: After researching for about an hour my husband finds Osaka. After going over the menu we read some reviews, and found that some people didn't really like it and others absolutely loved. Well so did we! Yes the outward appearance of this hidden gem may ward off some but that's what I love about it extremely low pro. inside you find a small but well appointed and well decorated place. The food was great we ordered the Osaka rice kamikaze roll octopus fritters sashimi BBQ short ribs spicy edamame king crab tempura Salmon Kama. Our waiter Alex was a huge help with ordering since you see we ordered a lot for the two of us. As well as killed  the Sake sampler with the apple raspberry and lychee flavors and a whole bottle of the Lychee Sake (as you can see that one was our favorite. Late night menu ROCKS! Wish I could have ate more! Definitely going to become one these newcomers favorite hang out.

20wgWFyyZR8orBUpdVcQeg.text: I brought my boyfriend and our good friends for dinner on Tuesday. We had a great time. Our friends were delighted by the ambiance of the dining area. The sushi was wonderful. We had three bottles of the Zipang Sake and it was priced just right. Cheesecake with strawberries along with two different flavors of Mochi. The mango was really good, but not a big fan of the green tea Mochi. Always be back to this restaurant!

c1bqd6Fj_vjq94xydc1VRQ.text: We love Osaka!!!  They have very fresh, delicious sushi and sashimi.   There are very few restaurants around that I could say that about.  We've been there many times in the past 4 years and never been disappointed.  As for the person complaining about the price, I understand that you want to have accurate information, however $40.00 per person is very average for a full dinner of sashimi and sushi.  We've paid that much at any sushi restaurant we've ever been to.  (even the gross ones)  This place really does rock though!!!

WluuyRkTMuIxDw5KgggT4A.text: I have been going to Osaka since 2005!  It's AMAZING!!!!  I mean, quality fish...friendly service.  The 777 is my FAVORITE!!!!!  When we lived overseas for a few years we'd come back once a year.  I'd make sure to head straight to Osaka for my 777 and much more!!  Whew...really amazing place...you have to try it!

6b9rFBQylYzWkrmvAokBEg.text: Busy at 2:30 in the afternoon. This is one of the few off strip high quality places in Vegas. We had the Roppongi roll, 911 roll and Tiger Rolls, all incredible. The bldg/decor is not that great bit the food is top quality. The Toro ranks at the top. Prices very reasonable.

gUKcGNPKHdsAtBnXlHj4Jw.text: Great stop if your on Sahara. The fish was surprisingly fresh and the staff amiable. Would have been a 3 star review had it not been for the quality of fish and a unique assortment of specials. The Osaka or grunt fish was the bet I've had. Highly recommended for a quick bite but seating is a little cramped so no large parties.

554chyNvp7oq36rbjchJew.text: It is one of the places in Vegas that has been around awhile and not to mention burned down and worth rebuilding. The service for some reason has always be excellent. It use to be where I took dates. The sushi is decent and what I enjoyed the most was the atmosphere. If you buy an Osaka shirt, every visit gets you a bottle of saki. I am a huge sushi lover and fancy sushi has become pretty typical. Every time I have been there and sat at the bar they offer a complimentary bottle of saki. Nice! Just a nice place to go.

wrDmU3k9EVE_3mnc3PB8Bw.text: I took my fiance here on a formal date and this place was perfect! We sat at a tatami room for just him and I, it is a traditional japanese room were you have to remove your shoes and sit on your knees. It was so comfortable though and we felt like we was the only ones here because the rice screens separates all the tables and it feels more like a private dinner. I loved it! Oh and right when you walk in you are greeted from every person you pass by who works there. Our waitress was so nice and have a sense of humor. In the menu there was just so much to chose from. We were soo full but my fiance still wanted to try the desert which was the fried tempura ice cream. Damn I was good to go after that. It was like a orgasm in your mouth haha. Well I would definately go here again but only on special occassions.

ZMLrbtvod1IBXCKNHnVWOg.text: This is the place that made me a believer!  I have always been leary of sushi, but after my experience here I love it now.  Not been to a ton of places, but this is the place I base all others on.  And none have come close.  I can't get enough of the 911 roll.  And everyone I have told about this place all agree this place is tops.  Also you can't beat there sushi happy hour and the ambiance all in all Osaka is great.

l1pxmW3BPMUEhGiMJpWfLQ.text: I come to osaka often now, lately at least once a month, so I feel I need to upgrade them to a 4.5-5. Their service and food is pretty consistent, but the reason I'm upgrading their score is because of the servers. They are always very courteous and come by to refill drinks at least twice each time i visit. They even have tolerance for the lurkers... you know, those people who stay at the restaurant way past the time necessary after eating there. (I, unfortunately, know this from personal experience... thank you for not kicking us out!). So a shout out to the workers at osaka!

CUxumEA1yohsYtjqKtNyMg.text: What a great place.  Everyone was friendly.  The food was delicious.  Dinner for five and a child with drinks about $275.  The chef put on quite a show for us.

XZkIR1yIBe4hzZr4fWCQUQ.text: We have been going to the Osaka on Sahara for years.  If you can get past the crazy entrance and the basic first dining room, you will be impressed with the other rooms, the prices, and the tasty food.  We love the choices offered, and it is always fresh and prepared to our specifications.,  We had friends fly in for business, and told them to go there to eat.  they really questioned my recommendations as they entered, but at the end of the meal, they raved and raved.

FaM4Mg8jHeMy0Vh3Tb8BvQ.text: A good place to get away from the Vegas strip. Sushi is decent and not as over priced as other places.

u3CKEtlEyUNHR5OvyU2bug.text: This was my favorite restaurant in 1999. The Japanese Sushi chefs were engaging, talented and very hospitable. In a dearth of culture and social connection, these guys made me feel like a king. Twelve years later? It was comforting to see the same art and decor. But when I entered and was ignored and left without a sign telling me to wait or move forward to one of the other rooms, it was uncomfortable. Three chefs ignored me, the waitress walked by and looked at me, no acknowledgement, and continued serving others. What happened to this place? You have a Las Vegas icon, once upon a time it was Caesars or Osaka, now everyone loves Sushi (thank you everyone, I can get plenty of good sushi everywhere, thanks to you) and Osaka is not worth passing the next Sushi place to get to. It's expense account expensive with average service and average food. The ankimo was fishy, the chu-toro was stringy and no better than the hamachi (wouldn't it be better to say you were out rather than dress up a fatty hamachi or blue-fin?). One saving grace, in a world of competitive all you can eaters downing monster portions of nigiri and sashimi, the portions of nigiri were small and mouth sized, beautiful. Sushi is a delicate food served with style and grace, thank you for the small portions. But then the cut roll menu looks like Denny's with the "me-too" monster portions and americanized flavor. Help!

W1VfnKy7y1hhRFssczbSmA.text: im a big sushi fan n i got to say out of alot of place ive tried in vegas this is surely one of the BEST!!! they got amazing happy hour!..the waiters are very nice n friendly i prob come here every two weeks n they know me n my orders lol...this place is very chill n there booths are what japanese style so u take your shoes off but i really recomend coming here n tryin a few of there amazing sushi rolls!!!!!

wditJ9YzTGm6jw5cqGWcXQ.text: Went to Osaka's on a Wednesday evening. It was around 9:30 PM, kind of a late dinner so it wasn't too busy. The place was quaint, peaceful and the service was pretty good. I ordered the chicken katsu which wasn't anything out of the ordinary and a beer on top of that. The prices are decent, the staff is friendly. But I was kinda looking for the "A-Ha" factor here.. and it never showed up.  Overall, good experience, but if you're looking to be blown away.. I'd do a little bit more searching.

oseEAm1G6APEPNcfviuFhA.text: Sometimesyoy get more than what you pay for--that sums it up in a nutshell. The rolls are buttery goodness. My sister and I sat in one of the wood bench rooms and ate to our heart's content.  It's simple, expected , and friendly enough to make you want to give them more business.

pCKOIdDZgwfdnnTVvr16ug.text: Quality, mouth melting, fresh sushi and sashimi. Most of the nigiri and roll sushi pricing was spot on (reasonable esp for Vegas) but the pricing on few of the items left me scratching my head wondering if they came sprinkled with gold flakes on top. Overall good place to go for sushi. Service was satisfactory; No complaints nor compliments (We did have a fairly large group though). Seating is either sushi bar, table, or tatami. They also have a few teppan grill tables.

VLUCZHz0xWz1WhJ3In33QA.text: I eat here at least once EVERY TIME I visit Vegas.  It's not your 100% authentic Japanese sushi place but hey I'm not a sushi snob.  I would have to say that they have the largest selection of Americanized Sushi Rolls anywhere.  The 777 roll is my favorite.  The "hot" foods are not bad but pale in comparison to their rolls.  Order a few of the special rolls and you're good to go.  California Rockin Sushi has NOTHING on this place.  In fact ever since I started going to Osaka I refuse to ever eat at CRS.

NbAOPUh_sRo-128JWrqKiw.text: I have been coming here for the last two years, and the service is friendly and warm; But as recent as last week, I notice they have new waiters and they aren't as friendly.  The sushi is consistently fresh, although it might not be the best cut like those I've had in Orange County. But if you're into tempura, this is the best place to go; it beats Frenzy Sushi in OC's tempura rolls.  The chef here are creative and they consistently create rolls that incorporate the East and West ingredients to provide customers with one of a kind experience.  If you like to try as many different roll as possible,go for it and get half roll instead of full roll, and trust me it's worth it. The tempura rolls are party-in-your-mouth good. I think it's great place to try to bring your love ones who are a little iffy about trying raw fish.  They won't notice because of the freshness of the fish and also the tasty sauce that come with it.  Other than the roll, their nigiri and sashimi are alright.  The uni is another good one to try, very fresh and buttery.  I got my sister to try it, and she's not a big sushi fan.

9nxDkxNh2FSs69FWTyDAKQ.text: Forget the Strip or Fremont, Sahara Ave has everything!   Based on all of the reviews, people seem to either love Osaka or hate it. I love the place. I never had sushi before I tried Osaka and now I'm addicted. Since I'm not expert, I'll keep it short.  Why i love the place: -Eat the volcano roll. it's the most delicious food item I've even tasted in my life. - the rolls all come in half or whole, so you can order lots of different rolls and share. - the place is affordable. -The flat screen tvs at each booth have a looping slide show of everything that they sell in the place. if your conversation falls off, you can drool at the tvs.

60UCRwHjLVTrQokNHWxGQg.text: My favorite sushi place in all of Vegas.  Fast turn over and fresh fish. Great late night specials and excellent service.  A must try!

46VPCjX71FXkgwRKCfI6Aw.text: This place is awesome! Extremely good service. Awesome happy hour prices. Most sushi rolls are 4-9 dollars for 12-2. This place might have gotten me hooked on sushi and I dont think I want to settle for anything less. Only reason Im giving 4 stars is because I ordered some weird sushi. Nothing against the restaurant. I just didnt know what I was ordering. Some of the sushi is served hot and I did not know that from just looking at the menu. Other than that this place is awesome. ALSO! I did not try dessert here but they have tempura ice cream and fried oreos and cheesecake here!!!

tucshSosxVaeG801gr493Q.text: This is one of those places that only the locals know about. Best quality Sushi in town!!

jqFf6XeBRSPE2RUNOIyVIg.text: I lived in Las Vegas for a couple of years and this is one of the places I miss the most.  They always have good food and have never disappointed me.  On this visit my hubby had some assorted sushi - which he just loved - and I had a combination dinner.  The tempura was cooked perfectly and the chicken was moist and delicious.

FeKpM5IX5a3xYImQwPnvmw.text: The food is average, nothing special =\ The person controlling the music wasn't soo good a lot of stop and play. One of the waitress was careless & just was like yea yea. The names on the menu was cool something different but that's about it =T

RiCPI9QxIVEBlW4DU4B8jA.text: Great food and the service is always GREAT, however it is a bit pricey. Maybe not the best place for kids

k_C_vo9hLF_AXeD8JG4d0w.text: This location is my favorite...yes its a older building but the tunami rooms are awesome :-) I love slipping off my shoes and slidding into the tunami booths. Something about the cozy intamate booth munching on good food while sipping on some plum wine....sigh* it just puts me in my happy place :-) and for you parents out their with toddlers...the tunami rooms are perfect for little ones (like mine) that do not like sitting still and being in high chairs :-D they are able to move more and stand while eating while keeping them nicely contained ;-) you can actually have a nice meal without chasing around your little cuteness!!

_cQ61ViQVO4ZEqH983OpfQ.text: Nice Hibachi style and sushi restaurant. Food tasted great and the table chef was very entertaining. Price was OK and the place was full on a weekday. Lots of birthdays that evening. Atmosphere not that great and the neighborhood is changing.

mYI7AHBzp_6Uz7zxEh4Txw.text: My boyfriend and I wanted some late-night sushi on a weekday. We were on the strip, but couldn't find anything open past 10pm. One of the door guys at Bally's suggested it so we grabbed a cab. It's a bit off the the strip, but I'd probably walk across the country for sushi. We sat at the sushi bar, which was pretty dead (as was the rest of the place, it was like 11pm on Tuesday). We ordered a handful of rolls, all super delicious! The Chef was making unique rolls, not on the menu, which is always fun! Bill was pretty cheap for all the food we ate. All and all, it was pretty good. Only negative would be the distance from the strip to the place, but well worth the cab fare!

tnPJey9IVWzwHb6Nwu42yg.text: Absolutely wonderful sushi. The 1-star and 2-star reviews have absolutely no clue about real sushi. This place doesn't cater to california styles ... it serves some but its strength is traditional plates and -real- sake (the kind that is still cloudy and you -want- to drink with your meal not just sip).   The only reason I didn't give 5-stars was due to the out of the way location and tiny frontage. But in a town like Vegas that can be a bonus, too.

trZn14eokxB3vyRGomx9mg.text: Are you sh*ttin' me?    Worst.  Sushi.  Ever.  May be we should have stayed away from the sashimi and nigiri.  May be when we asked about omakase and the waitress didn't know what we were talking about we should have just ordered some standard rolls off the menu.  May be they should have given us some fresh fish instead of the wretched crap they served.  May be upon seeing the dryness/lack of luster on the fish we should have just not eaten.  May be that salmon roe was in fact not from a jar.   May be I can recover from this horrible experience to enjoy sushi once again.  May be.  But probably not anytime soon...

QEdL1uGIrd0CEkwpvW1xJQ.text: This is the best sushi restaurant in town. We had the omakase (chef's choice) and had his specialties. The sashimi here is really fresh and tasty. The prices overall on the  menu was very reasonable. The cost on the omakase is really up to you. We told him $80/person and we had over 10 dishes. (2 of which had toro) You can always set this lower and order more later if you're still hungry.   They do have coupons available. Check online or in the local advertisements.

-9k6ZftKxwLszNRb_Zs61g.text: LISA LISA IS THE BOMB. Just saying. So my sister and I came here with our Dad, he had been living in Las Vegas for about a year, and he wanted to show us what good 'Las Vegas sushi' tasted like. I was skeptical. I mean, Las Vegas is a freakin' desert so I didn't expect the sushi to be as impeccable as we have it here in the city by the bay. Nicky B is a pretty foolish kid.   We walked in and I was immediately amazed with all the cool-futuristic-tables and high definition televisions that played menu items over and over again. We sat down at the sushi bar. Our sushi-chef was really nice. My dad knew him, so we he talked to us about stuff. Pretty cool. Then comes the food. I take a bite. I'm blown away! Wow. It was incredible. Tasty. Ahhh. Lisa Lisa I love you. Try it ya'll. You'll fall in love too.

bn8Ppo-cK33MzCQIltyGgw.text: The BEST EVER!!! from the waiter..David..who brought be stuff he thought I'd like to the food!! My WHOLE meal was WONDERFUL!! had the ume handroll which had a special adding to it..NEVER had one that was better!! And had the curry udon..no doubt the BEST udon EVER!!! SooO awesome Japanese restaurant!! Next time I'll sit in the back thats like authentic Japanese eating! LOVE this place..I'll be back!!

IDWEoD7EschrOqiMB6JRUQ.text: has the best food here love the theme and the cooking show it is really cool

5XTHZ-BrqJFfGxZ8WkBZ-g.text: Who would have thought that the desert could serve some good fish?  Well after much searching through the phone book and online listings, I found a great Japanese restaurant while vacationing in Las Vegas.  Every time I'm the area, I always end up having dinner here at least once.  I'm big on the raw fish, and Osaka takes the cake for having really good sushi while not hammering too hard on the price. And it's not one of those Asian fusion restaurants on the Strip, so that adds to its appeal.    If you're in the mood for Japanese, try this place.  Plus they have combo dinners and soups that would appeal to the non-raw fish eaters too.

b5CJwom9NlZkFlhRT0eFHQ.text: What can I say? The BEST JAPANESE RESTAURANT IN VEGAS! ^_^  I love their rolls, their sashimi are so fresh and delicious!  My fav dinner dish is Teriyaki beef, they are smoky!  They have Teppan table but I always prefer the sitting at the tatami room, cause it's so cozy and private if you want to bring your partner.  Service is wonderful, and food came out fast.  For desert, I recommend the green tea mousse, they have the most prefect taste, not too sweet and not too creamy.

F0kAKvWl8iFX5IC5tliO7w.text: Osaka is simply the best locals sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. They are always consistent. The fish is fresh and I have never had a bad meal. Do not compare this place or its prices with an all you can eat joint.

ySmZ05BJqsCx3UgEw-UpqA.text: Well, the gal and I rolled in at about 1:30 AM.  The place was pretty empty.  The atmosphere:  a little dreary, diveish, and old but overall fairly clean.  The service was decent.  Nothing to gripe or write home about.    The food:  forgettable.  The Korean style chicken was utter crap.  Stir-fried and all you could taste was spice.  Hello?  Korean chicken is supposed to be deep-fried.    I also ordered the udon off the late-night menu.  The broth had completely no taste whatsover.  They could have used minimal effort to load it with salt and MSG and that would have been a huge improvement, though not very imaginitive.    The gyoza was ok but obviously store-bought.    Would I go again?  No, I would rather go to Albertsons' and buy a microwave dinner.

PVsIzVFpKemqE8yaVhb28g.text: I extremely lover this restaurant! My favorite place ever and the food is amazing especially the beef and chicken is cooked perfect and tender and prices were great as well but cheaper if you eat the same thing just lunch hours but totally worth it either way!

shuzJnZSfCoInFGnCDr2xg.text: The OMG roll was just that! And the Kamisama roll was great yummo!! Also, the service was professional and courteous. Definitely recommend this one to all foodies and kid-friendly too!

hpsxZ7MBEMMPPFi8y2UpEA.text: Always fresh food. Seafood salad is great and must try their scallop dishes!  Another place I go every time I'm in Vegas!

_-bpvbi33Tyms16PjbimWw.text: I came here with a group of 5 for a birthday dinner a few weeks ago. Everybody loved it. We had one of the tables in the back to ourselves (I thought it was kinda fun eating with no shoes on) and the service was very quick. 2 of us came specifically for the Okonomi Yaki and we were not disappointed. We'll definitely be coming back here.

8FbxvfCFOYTilFVgYQ-Z4w.text: This is a layback take off your shoes(literally) Tatami tables kind of place, cozy and comfortable place to enjoy delicious Japanese cuisine. Love the variety of prices not so expensive(lots of options) can be if you don't take the time to read the menu.... Overall it's a great place for Sushi, teriyaki platter, or Kobe-beef.

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna rolls good w/ sake yum

NWp4uKW1ovVkaPzWj-SnKQ.text: I think it's very sad when the TV commercial says "food prepared by professional Japanese chefs" in the picture shows some white guy chef flipping some food to a Japanese family. Fortunately the food wasn't as awful as that stupid commercial. When we were there my chef couldn't even speak a word of Japanese. I think most Japanese chefs know a little bit of Japanese because of their family origin.

zc8D7ZsS9krDbiMPC18NQw.text: I've been here before I moved to Vegas about 3 years ago and liked it so we returned for a birthday dinner. As you open the door you're greeted by a wall and a slightly off putting smell. Still I'm here and hungry, we're doing this! We were seated in the traditional Japanese table and our waiter was friendly. We ordered the yellowtail collar, miso sea bass, sashimi plate, and I LOT of salmon nigiri. Our waiter offered to upgrade the the salmon to "butter salmon" for .95 an order more, and yes I want the best RAW fish so we upgraded. Water and tea were refilled promptly and endlessly but our waiter kinda disappeared and left us hanging on who to order more food with. I wish he had just given us a quick heads up, especially since we had hungry kids wanting more of that salmon. All told it was an ok experience. The lack of stars attributed to the fact that if I have to upgrade my salmon you should get rid of the lower quality salmon and serve the best as a sushi place should. Also, the bathroom really smelled, like into the hallway sewage smell. This place has been around since 1967 and is in need of some upgrades. I'll be looking for a better fit for my next sushi dinner out.

XDY-uBkmRFogKjXzkOitBg.text: Quite possibly the best nigiri I've had.  It's clear that they know their fish and provide great quality.  The 12 piece chef's choice nigiri was a great value at $35, with excellent amaebi, uni, toro etc.  Well over $35 worth of sushi and every piece was great quality.  Even the beef teriyaki that my 7 year old nephew had received excellent reviews from everyone at the table due to the quality of the meat.    The service of the staff lived up to the quality of the food as well. If you're visiting the strip and want some great Japanese food, avoid the crowds and head a couple miles west on Sahara to Osaka.  I'll be going every time I'm in town.

1lMzF0zoTzyQyLSkjStc3Q.text: We went here because it was a Diners Drive-ins and Dives recommendation!  We were happy to say that Guy was right on!  I'm not a fan of seafood but this place did not smell of seafood and we sat in the same room as the sushi bar!  My husband and daughter had sushi and soup and I had chicken and all three dishes were delicious.  The servers were very attentive and the experience was a good one.  Will visit again the next time we go to Vegas!

MEYRtENxoRzNSZE1K1sjiA.text: Went here for the first time and absolutely love! They have a HUGE menu and quality fish.  Tasteful, fresh and clean. Service was also great. Server was kind and helpful, all staff were attentive. Little pricey but definitely worth it.

7pNK42TP2j2CUptSwOBFIw.text: Came in for a birthday at the teppanyaki grill area with a group of 6. Great cook with a great show. Had the fish and veggies entree. Honestly never had a better fish and veggies dinner. Thank you!! Loved it!!

Z_uEiqqnMULd_z-0gduEAQ.text: We went to this small older Japanese restaurant located in an outdated strip mall about 15 minutes from Elara on 4/10/17 for lunch.  Since they have limited tables, we ended up dining in one of the tatami rooms.  The sushi and nigiri was fine but not outstanding. Had the salad with seared tuna.  Not too bad but I have had better.   Prices were reasonable for the dishes but portions were on the small side.  Service was adequate though the waiter forgot to bring the miso soup that came with the lunch and we had to remind him at the end of the meal.   Probably not on my list to revisit on our next trip to Vegas since there are many other sushi restaurants to explore.

eQwRQEzanmMveMFebRQP7g.text: Customer service deserves 5 stars. Food is good quality but the amount you get for the price is the reason I took a star off. We got the small sashimi platter that you can share with 2 or more people and the slices of the fish were a little small. They charged us for sides of rice which usually come with sashimi dinners. They also charged for green tea which most authentic places from home don't but this is also Vegas without many Japanese options.

h9P2dbPji8PTXX2fAS9rcw.text: They just have c rated from the city.it is expansive than before.long time eater here.

5ctWiQvy1DRPbOltrV3yXg.text: Amazing selection of specialty rolls and appetizers. Unfortunately they don't have AYCE... BUT the rolls are so good, it's worth it. They have a ton of unique and tasty sauces and make everything they serve taste like a little piece of heaven. Favorites include: The Virgin Roll (a great starter sushi roll for those just venturing into sushi town), Japanese Lasagna, Lisa Lisa, U-My Roll (which is a mouth full, for sure).   They have a bunch of different seating options (Dining Room, Japanese style tables, and Teppan) and it's a really cute place. Overall, one of my favorites and it's not far from the strip (at least it doesn't seem that far, but nothing does when it tastes good!!).

wbVvWNESBaSrEuz96fhIKQ.text: 2 words, JAPANESE LASAGNA!!!!!!! BEST IN TOWN!!!! i love this place, i love the seating and customer service! the sushi has never been bad here and ive always been in a great full mood when we leave.

A48vYqEoYgRIonlvkHzt9A.text: Decent japanese in vegas area. Usually,people go to japanese all you can eat but quality isnt good. Osaka had very good quality of fish.

CrrddV6GYD6BuiFhHH0RhQ.text: Amazing first time (hibachi) experience! The service was superb and the entertainment was magical. I had the 18$ dollar three course meal shrimp special and it was worth every dime my friends and I spent! Can't wait to go back!

g0nd4J_lzPqXyULf4xMHGw.text: Got at the restaurant, got seated in a open room with a very comfy sitting area. They brought out drinks very fast and we had 3 waiters which made me feel very special and had my food out almost instantly. Was quiet with soothing music. My group ordered all different sushi's which we all picked off of. They cleaned off all of our dishes and the dessert was outstanding. This restaurant is definitely one of my favorite restaurants now.
