a1mTRCxKDg8qECLrKWHaEg.text: First time here, the sushi was DELICIOUS! The  service was great too, they were very welcoming, definitely going back next time I visit Vegas.

pciftEGFwdPpRXK_svas0w.text: Loved the food!! I had a great time with my cousins at the restaurant. We got to sit in a tatami room which was a real treat!! My only complaint would be the organization. We had three waiters and which was slightly overwhelming. Overall, eating at Osaka was a positive experience and I highly recommend it. 9fs40WJg59FOREqQHfWTNQ.text: The food is okay, but there are fruit flies everywhere, can't even enjoy your meal without having to shoo flies from your plate.   Also the "lunch special" is 3$ for a ca roll But it's only 4 pieces, meaning it's only 1/2 the size of a real roll. So 6$ for a full ca roll is over priced   I won't be coming back...

6j8qhW8NDaf-7f4LXX27Nw.text: Friendly service and phenomenal sushi. Doesn't get much better than that. This is the first time my husband and I have gotten a boat because we finally went with friends instead of just the 2 of us. We got the titanic and it was awesome! I'm not a big sashimi fan so the others enjoyed that but I loved the rolls. The 911 was my favorite because of the spice but the lasagna roll was really yummy too. I was surprised at the warm gooeyness and all the flavors melted together perfectly. I also think it's awesome that they offer half roll options for many of their items so you can try a  larger variety. I also tried sho chu for the first time, which is like a sweet potato vodka, and it was smooth and delicious. My friends got a bottle of Nigori Matca, which they graciously shared with me, and it was amazing! I could drink that all day!

Uy8lo_cHJCQRtk3koG7Hww.text: Ok, this place has been around for a long time!  The care and the quality of everything they do shows.  Attentive and caring staff at this establishment.    A diverse (LARGE) menu has items for all tastes.     Sorry, I kept eating the specials before I remembered to take photos (haha!).

4BMjhPx2HLChj2Dg7P5yUQ.text: My husband wanted gizzards and they have them broiled.  So we visited there yesterday evening and got those, along with soup, curry and teriyaki.  Everything was so good!  We will definitely go back.

qW2sSw15DZL25B0w9_oERQ.text: Now that Yelp is offering delivery from so many excellent restaurants, there really should be an option to mark the review "in-house, "take out," or "delivery."   I've eaten at Osaka once before, in-house, for a birthday treat. It was before Yelp, but I would have posted a very favorable review for it back then. My only criticism would have been that they didn't serve pickles with the rice.  This review is for their delivery service through Yelp.  I recently reviewed another sushi establishment based on a delivery order. I was disappointed then; this experience was so much better!  The sushi we ordered was prepared beautiful, generous but not overly big slivers of fresh, sweet fish on expertly prepared rice. And the presentation, for delivery food, was excellent. They even included that plastic "grass," which is annoying, but at least is says "we tried!" All the boxes were labeled with the menu item they included, a really nice touch! And the order was correct; a blessing. We asked for extra chopsticks and wasabi, and they sent us service for eight, with enough wasabi and ginger to keep our nasal passages clean for a month!  We ordered tempura as well, and that's where this establishment lost its fifth star. The tempura was a bit heavy and oily. The dense oily texture was due in part, I'm sure, to "delivery time lapse," because tempura is meant to be eaten hot out of the oil. Even a few minutes left sitting will cause it become oily. And reheating is problematic, as the shrimp will be over cooked and the veggies limp. So even though it's really no one's fault but mine (for ordering it), I still had to pull that last star.   This place is not cheap. You can balance the price with the quality though, and order judiciously. And certainly, a couple of rolls and a side would be a better value, but I prefer traditionally prepared nigiri, so we ordered no rolls.  We'll be returning to the restaurant later this month for my birthday; a Living Social deal so very budget friendly. And I can heartily recommend this restaurant for its delivery service! Well, except the tempura, but if you order fried food for delivery, it's your fault!

fTghH7xGor-eBO3Q10cZIQ.text: Great food and great service. What can you say. We had awesome Sashimi and sushi and they were amazing. It was to awesome ! Good size portions and good Saki too. iyoUVIMx9B_MXKgnydvO-w.text: A staple of mine while I was going to school down the street, I am almost obligated to write a review for this fine establishment. A sushi joint that has yet to let me down.   Osaka serves all of their items a la carte, so no AYCE. But if you have the extra money and want better quality sushi than what you would get from a AYCE place, come here.  Anytime of day is a good time to come, they have lunch and late night specials. The rolls and nigiri are always fresh and delicious, and I regularly order their various bento boxes, combo meals, and appetizers. I am more of a nigiri guy, but this place has plenty of appetizing and unique rolls that I will often order. As I stated earlier, this place has yet to let me down, I have ordered a lot of different items off the menu, and they are always on point.  The service is always top notch. The wait staff is always attentive, and will always customize your order to your liking. I've never gotten a wrong order, food that took forever to come out, or items missing. If you decide to eat at the bar, the sushi chefs are awesome, and will always start up conversation to be friendly and to see what you would want to order and make suggestions. One of my go to chefs is Oscar. He is normally there during the lunch hours, and always makes awesome rolls. He even does his own custom order of baked mussels with Sriracha sauce that is awesome, ask for it, and he will be happy to make it for you.  While not necessarily a con, it can be pricey to get your fill here  if you just plan on eating sushi. But it comes with better quality of food, so it almost cancels itself out. They at least have a reward card here to accumulate some free food after a couple of visits.  It is one of the older sushi spots in Vegas for a reason. Top quality food with awesome service is always a good combo when eating out somewhere.

ZMP2c5bkKKbbYkZ-pkc0bQ.text: I'm big on first impressions, so when friends said this place was good, we decided to check it out.  Our waitress was very nice. The sushi was descent and the beer selection was great.  Here's the bad: terribly slow service. It took over 30mins to make a simple roll. Luckily we dined with friends so we weren't in a hurry but we hardly saw our waitress. I shouldn't have to flag people down just to find out the status of an order. When she did finally return, she gave us our check. She never came back. Had to go to the counter to pay which is no big deal but I waited for 20mins just to pay. Staff just walked by me and several people waiting to pay, not even acknowledging anyone.  I won't return. There is a huge selection of sushi places I would rather go to.

The soup wasn't my favorite, nothing wrong with the soup, I just think that type of soup is not for me. I starting to see that I don't like Asian Soups. I did like the Shrimp Tempura though. I should have ordered that.   My server was a so nice and the service was very good. Everyone that worked at the restaurant was very kind.   The only complaint that I have about this place is the part of the restaurant we were sitting in, the booth area, it didn't smell the cleanest. We had to take off our shoes and sit on a cushion at a table that was low to the ground, like traditional Japanese tables but it had an opening for our feet to touch the ground. It kind of smelt like feet. I thought maybe I was hallucinating but I asked my dad if he smelt it too and he said yes. So that's my only complaint.   Everything else was fine and it was cool trying traditional Japanese Food while visiting Las Vegas.

7gEvv0iVOr4Tcu-iFXhIhA.text: If you're in Vegas and you love Japanese food, you must visit this place. I saw it on an episode of DDD and I knew I had to check it out on my trip to Vegas. They stay open till 2am so we went for a very late dinner. They have a late night menu but the full menu is also available (not including the Teppan Grill). We had sushi, Teppan scallops, cold soba noodles, shiitake and chicken skewers and katsu soft shell crab. The chicken thigh skewer was our least favorite. It was sorta bland. c9KrMPyhws0zLmEZeio5Hg.text: We had the hankering for sushi while in Vegas. Of course, we checked yelp and searched for some of the best sushi. Well, that searched sent us to Henderson, NV to check out Osaka. We made reservations and made our way there. Located in a standalone building in a strip mall, we arrived prepared to enjoy what they had to offer . . We lucked up as we had the restaurant to ourselves which meant the staff catered to our every move and want. We opted for sitting at the sushi counter. Perfect for watching the chef prepare our food . . We came during lunchtime so we had a small salad to start and a miso soup. Next we ordered a classic favorite yellowtail and scallion with a side of edamame . . We finished with the Tiger roll. I love a good sushi roll that has balance. I'm not a huge fan of spicy roll but if it has more than one fish and only one has a little bit of spice then I can handle it as it's not overpowering the entire roll . .  If your in or near Henderson, NV be sure to check them out. They also have a hibachi section and tons of other options which I'm sure is just as good!

2_EYifydrx-c1VzFx14nGQ.text: AMAZING IN EVERY WAY! the most impeccable service you could ever imagine. I felt like I was the only table there. Watching the masters make our sushi was beautiful. The atmosphere was nice and relaxing with soft music.  The floor in the main room is carpeted. This is risky for a food establishment but as someone with arthritis I can tell you IT MADE MY ENTIRE EXPERIENCE WONDERFUL. I can't sit with time or hardwood under my legs without a lot of pain and I felt so good after my meal.  The food! The gyoza is the BEST ive ever had. The udon was so tasty. You can get any standard sushi roll deep fried! I had a deep fried California roll and it was yummy. The shrimp fried rice and teriyaki chicken were both terrific.  I cannot wait to eat here again soon! Also, very reasonable prices.

m9LXKWt8yxFcSZR3SRWfyw.text: Quick Review: Great value in the late night menu, good, but expensive food at other times of the day.  Long-Winded Review: When I grew up in Vegas in the 80's, there were only 1-2 Japanese restaurants in town, but they were very authentic ones that served food you could find in Tokyo.  Fast forward 20 years and we have a Sushi restaurant on every corner.  Teriyaki Chicken is served at Jack in the Box.  You can get California Rolls at 7-11.  There are hundreds of "Japanese" restaurants out now, but they're as close to Japanese as Olive Garden is Italian.  Osaka's menu remains largely grounded in its Japanese roots, but it also features a good selection of "custom" sushi rolls that you'll find in other sushi restaurants.  The menu is extensive, and some parts may be difficult to navigate since it is in Japanese (or the English equivalent, Romaji).  Item descriptions are all too brief and unless you've been there before, you may be intimidated by ordering something new.  It's probably best to ask your server or sushi chef questions before ordering.  What troubles me about Osaka is that I feel it's trying to be all things to all people.  It serves authentic Japanese fare, but it's also trying to be edgy, trendy, and hip by offering experimental fusion dishes and desserts.  However, the fact that I still go there regularly suggests that Osaka's experimentation doesn't bother me all that much.  As with older Japanese restaurants, prices are a tad higher than other places in town ($15 for chicken teriyaki dinner vs. $9.95 at other places), but the quality is much better.  You're not going to get as much food, but if you're looking for quantity, I can suggest some good all-you-can-eat sushi places that will feed you for under $30.  The real value of Osaka is its late night menu (10 pm - 2 am).  It features a wide variety of food for under $10.  You can get rolls and appetizers for $5 or less, and entrees are available for under $10.  The Japanese Style Beef Bowl is a steal at $5.80 (it's like a Yoshinoya Beef Bowl, but tastier).  It's a great place to go with friends after/before clubbing since you can do a family-style meal.  Desserts are hit or miss.  The Tempura Ice Cream is a great value at $5.50 and it easily serves 2-4 people.  Some of the other items are good, but definitely not worth the high price.

UWNCaD0syqqNG3_jwBA__Q.text: This place has a True japanese feel to it. It is a small, almost divey, place. There is a room for table seating, a room for sitting with the chef as he prepares your meals and a room for good ole Japanese style seating. You remove your shoes and you sit on a pad and down low. We sat here. It was awesome. The initial server that serves you water and drinks and busses your table was a mid-aged white man who spoke very well (very educated) and it was a dismal reality check as to the stake of our economy that this professional has been reduced to busser work. Not that we don't love or need our bussers, they definitely keep the restaurant in order. I couldn't refuse the sushi. I ordered a half roll of the Asakusa (Spicy Tuna Roll topped with Albacore & Scallions) which was close to orgasmic. I ordered a standard yellowtail roll and then I checked out the rest of the entrees and found a Curry Tempura (which does not seem to be on their online menu). It was FANtastic!! Needless to say I left with happy taste buds and a loaded stomach. If I go back to Vegas I will most certainly be visiting here again.

uESZd4jGcsBYghTIzCn0hA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas and it has been that way going on 10 years.  Its got a real neighborhood feel too it.  Food is always fresh and service is super polite and prompt.  I just love to go there after work and take off my shoes and lounge around on the pillows.  I recommend the chicken teriyaki, tempura shrimp and veggies and Japanese sandwiches.

7xGxkr3dm4e0B_sm2oIthg.text: My fiance and daughter at here this past week. I really enjoyed the hole-in-the-wall type of feeling when you are walking in.  It has a unique feeling - a feeling you wouldn't normally get in a Las Vegas restuarant.  We were sat and I asked if we could possibly do the Hibachi. I figured my two year old might like it! Unfortunatly, they told us that this was not available and that reservations should be made for this. They placed us in this cozy section of the restauant (non hibachi) where we could order off of the menu. We ordered chicken and beef tariyaki and some veggie tempura. Food was good, not too overpriced. The wait staff was very polite and even brought out extra orange slices for my daughter.   If you looking for an inexpensive restaurant with a fun atmosphere, check it out! I would go back. It wasn't too overpriced, and anyone who treats my daughter to a toy from the toy box on their way out is a fan of mine!

wdcQqenKU0Q8gsk3awrAIQ.text: Osaka is easily one of the most civilized sushi restaurants in Vegas, and it's my "default" sushi spot.  I have come to thoroughly dislike the multitude of "fusion" sushi joints cropping up all over town. The majority of them are owned by Koreans and have little in common with traditional Japanese food.  Thankfully, Osaka is an oasis here in the Mojave desert. Having been around for more than 40 years, they were doing traditional sushi long before it has hip or trendy. And they've stuck with a traditional approach, relying on top-quality ingredients and skilled chefs.  The owner told me he gets his fish from the same supplier as Nobu and they often split a fish between the two restaurants. To the sushi snob, the difference is apparent.   As wonderful as the food is, the dining experience is what really sets Osaka apart. From the coziness of the sushi bar to the tranquility of the tatami rooms, Osaka offers the most civilized dining experience I've encountered so far. No blaring hip hop, no trendy decor, no pushy servers, just an hour or two of peace and tranquility to enjoy good quality food. It's like Zen meditation with raw fish. Divine.

Zo8XpgW4VQAS2LfRzsivPw.text: I have had consistently great service every time I come here. I haven't had anything I didn't like, and the sake selection is pretty impressive. The first time I went here, I was reassured to see a large table full of Japanese people, speaking Japanese. Does it get more reassuring than that?

02j39Wl2C1opbm40MRcfDQ.text: WOW!! first off.. i love the way the seating is!.. must take off shoes in a japanese feel!.. u sit on what seems to be a pillow and what u might think of going 'indian style' lol!..however!.. u pretty much can put ur feet down below.. and the table is right in ur face!.. the tables are very intimate as they are separated by a paper wall.=] love the bamboo steps to the table.. beware of holed socks.. cuz like i said, u gotta take off ur shoes lol. ahha Second of all, there are soo many menus.. i wanna say 3 menus to choose from??.. what a very large selection to chose from..! ..i tried the teriyaki beef dinner which comes with the whole salad and soup ordeal and some tempura veggie and shrimp.. our friends ordered a lot of sumthing! but it was very pleasing! and appetizing i might add!.. cannot forget the dessert!.. super huge portions.. and loved the fried plantains, the tempura ice cream!!..waiter was thee best!.. couldnt ask for better service!.. i would definitely go back..and it makes me wanna look for a restaurant similar to this in LA!.. prices r pretty good, with the fact that since its vegas they close pretty late, and its 1/2 off!..LOVe this PLACE! =]

6vuAQ4PXTEfb-f8DS3Lqug.text: One of my favorite places to eat at, especially for sushi! Their service is awesome and I love their tempura, miso soup, teriyaki chicken, japanese lasagna roll, etc. They also have great desserts! My favorite is the tiramisu. I know, you're thinking.. at a Japanese restaurant? Well, it's some of the best I've had & I've eaten tiramisu in Little Italy in NYC. Go check it out!

5BstR5GfqEc7VduFQwiVAA.text: This was my second time eating at Osaka and my LAST!!  The first time the palce was so crowded that I could understand the slow service, but at least the waitress was attentive.  Tonight the waitress was awful, just rude.  And her behavior progressed as we explained to her how disappointed we where that she never brought us bowls for our sauces so that we could dip our sushi, my tuna stuffed jalapeno poppers took forever to bring out and that is one of the easiest items to prepare on the menu and the fastest!!!  One of my friends went up to the front and got her own bowl and the hostess brought us more water because our waitress just disappeard.  After we complained she asked if we would like a free dessert and we accepted that, but she rolled her eyes at her after we asked her if she was new.  Her english could have been better too, this is a Japanese restaurant, why would you hire an hispanic waitress whose english is mediocre????  We will not be coming back there, EVER!!  The food is good, but for service like that it's way overpriced!!

LU0dYT9oQY3a3tzDsixRIQ.text: we always have birthdays here, they have great food, i have tried probably half of the items on the menu, the sushi is great, and they servers know us. we love the late night hours, and the late night prices. try it out

AqsefGxl2p68JhVTrvkU2w.text: Not the best but not bad for late night after hours. This is one of those places you go to when nothing else is open other than fast food or cafes in hotels. Tasty sushi, hit or miss on maguro sashimi.  The edamame portion has recently been shaved to a small handful of pods, at $2.95, now that's a rip off.  I had to work on Valentines, which by the way is a WAY overrated day, non the less the BF and I had a late night meal. He had the tonkatsu which he said was fabulous. I had sashimi and one roll. Like I said, not bad for late night dining, 1 in the morning. BTW, they close at 2

ZgydT9l0SZOh-McaPgC8sw.text: Came here on a busy Friday night.  The place was packed.  We had an assortment of sushi, and the teppanyaki.  I can't say enough about the excellent service and attention to detail.  All the sushi was delicious, try the sushi lasagna (omg, to die for!).  The teppan grill was great.  We had steak and salmon but first they served us soup and rice.  The soup was really yummy and I loved the little noodles, very yummy.  The fried rice was great (and cute pacman while they make it for the kids), and the meat and veges were so fresh.  The entire meal was just a pleasure.  The staff was so attentive.  They have a cool ordering system - they don't even have to go to the kitchen to place the order.  They just put it into their little handheld and the kitchen starts making your food.  The sushi came out so fast, we were hungry!  Can't wait to go back!  We were so full we only had room for a scoop of green tea ice cream.  The dessert menu looks amazing and I love all the pictures.

QvXZXvPK-gyvXgvnBLKELw.text: My favorite sushi spot. The food is killer and the staff exceptional. I like to go solo, sit at the sushi bar, and watch the chefs work their magic. Sushi is an art unto itself.

hazWsoF6U9iQ6AmkQmHMzg.text: If you're looking for great quality sushi, Osaka is the place to go. I have been coming to this specific location for 7 years now and this place will always be my favorite for the best quality sushi. I recommend trying this place out whether you enjoy raw fish or not...The service is wonderful and the staff is always friendly. Osaka has never let me down. The only problem i see personally is that it is not that spacious and the sushi bar is a bit crowded. Other than needing to expand their restaurant, everything is pretty amazing. Sushi love!!

cQOAeyrOCLn18MzR82upDw.text: Got suckered by DDD and gave this place a try...  Featured as the very first sushi place in LV..   I should've known better than to expect fresh sushi in a desert or trust Guy's pitch for Sushi on a show featuring Dives.. Buffet quality fish both cooked/raw Rice to fish ratio sucked.. Same on rolls.. Gave it one more star as I know Its hard to please LA pallets on asian food out of state.

M8FMBnq1OltkCtH6gLkJRA.text: I love the feel of this place. Yeah, it's older but it's a familiar Las Vegas older I grew up with in the 90s. It's got a local Las Vegas feel mixed with Japanese atmosphere. I like that it's not brand new or remodeled away it's soul.  The food is made with love. You can really feel the coolness when you eat the food. And the people who run the place are so nice.

v0OXxcbadHbhcVORRzJEQQ.text: I love everything about this place, such as sushi, combination plate, and love the plum wine.  Great customer service and good food

fF_GbuzFd4SMxbZGjMmosw.text: So good.  Very small place, not much for ambiance, but all of the food was super fresh and perfectly made.  The garlic edamame was unique and very good.  I've never had O Toro before, and I ordered it twice again after the first round. Also had the same sampler was a great addition.  Our server was nice, knowledgeable, and personable.    Overall highly recommended.

-Y1zLiyoJD-QBjaasY5ILg.text: The restaurant looked nice with exception to the brown water stain around the air conditioning intake vent. It was quiet inside with the exception that the front door we sat by slammed hard and squeaked continually due to lack of repair. The shabu-shabu was extremely sweet in comparison to more authentic cuisine. It tasted almost like candy, which leads me to believe it is over-Americanized. The gas burner we were using had trouble getting re-lit. When we turned it low, it would go out and we would have to manually re-light it. For as expensive as this restaurant was, they should be using stainless steel or ceramic chopsticks. This became most apparent when a member of my party wound up with a 1/8" splinter in her finger, from the cheap wooden disposable chopsticks.   At this point, the only redeeming quality we found to this restaurant was our waiter. Our waiter, Jared, proved himself to be one of the best waiters in the world. Despite, being incredibly stretched thin between two rooms, he was on top of all of our needs and wound up loaning us a lighter to re-light the defective burner. He was not only kind and courteous, but in the extreme emergency of needing tweezers to remove the splinter, he was able to retrieve a pair from the emergency first aid kit that he carries in his car; because no one else in the entire restaurant had any tweezers or way to help us. We didn't waste any time tipping him EXTREMELY well.

xCE8wGBP2PIy6hZBKoFwjQ.text: This restaurant is great for  food. It's absolutely delicious. The teriyaki chicken and the shrimp lovers combination. The flavors and the presentation is great. Mireya service was outstanding and from everyone else too ruby etc. Great place to eat and enjoy

Sw4BzwJB9fuKkE-3KBAhiQ.text: Came back and tried the king and Queen steak and lobster it was yummy my favorite so far outside of Benihana even better in my opinion because I prefer cute smaller restaurants with good food ;)

ziW1z03MtgO4ohqxzrziBQ.text: Authentic traditional sushi at its finest. The Japanese style tables with mats to sit on is pretty awesome. The sushi is delicious and creative. The flavors of the sushi sandwich were oh so good. The lunch specials are convenient for my co-workers and I. Staff is always great!

pkjhWtfMjqxMdfrvQdkMGg.text: Its exterior looks like an unassuming hole-in-the-wall. We came for a late lunch with barely anyone around and sat up at the front with the sushi chef. We ordered a variety of sushi rolls, nigiri and sashimi. They all tasted very delicious and fresh. I hadn't tried uni since high school when I decided I didn't like it and I was shocked to find that the piece I tried that day was actually quite palatable to me. I guess guess my tastes of changed. I quite liked their mackerel and the overall variety that they offered for their fresh sushi bar. Very impressive and would likely try again..

7zTQbwXTWZ3_gPCT1c5DcA.text: Great service, all the rolls I tried were amazing. Some of the best sushi I've ever had. Good sake selection. Would come back.   However, sitting at the sushi bar sucks: the countertop is so shallow that your knees clash with the wall beneath the counter. Could not find a comfortable seating position.

Hn1Rpuk5XjpDjywgfX7quw.text: We went in for a late lunch, kind of in a hurry. We picked 3 lunch special rolls, the 911, the white tiger, and Kai's special. We also ordered a full Tropical roll. The service was prompt and it was the best sushi we've had in a long time.

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This roll is called something Tropical. Sorry, I forgot the name.

hpkqLwBL_cN8bniyDq-PUw.text: Great place to dine with family and friends at both of Osaka's teppanyaki and seated areas.  Prices are reasonable and they have friendly service.

wWwVHJzE9Uinh1aLdgGoDQ.text: I have been going here for as long as I can remember and it has always been amazing! Delicious food and the show at the teppanyaki grill is great. Prices are fair for the amount of food and show that you get I highly recommend for birthdays or special events where you want to be entertained while eating! Will continue going here if they keep up everything the same they have since they opened!

_GI9LOSD-X_FCod1IKGYjQ.text: I come here every time I'm in town. It used to be one of the best Sushi places period. Always loved this place and recommended it to friends whenever someone was visiting. Yesterday I went, and for the first time was disappoint. The rolls just aren't as good as they used to be. Way too much rice and not enough fish. Plus the individual pieces were almost falling apart. I'm also not a fan of the fact that out of the four sushi chefs only one is actually Japanese.  What a shame.

M3B5ENN1UoDz8aGOsq3FMg.text: Exterior is unassuming, and you walk in to an immediate brick wall before entering the sushi bar. Very awkward. Japanese kitchen area is separate, did not go into it during my visit. Lunch menu til 4PM allowed me to score half-portion (and half-price) rolls for me and my guy, along with a salad and an app for around $40. Score!  Tuna poke salad ($8) was tasty, shrimp shumai ($5) was okay but didn't hit that craving-dim-sum spot that I hoped it would. Sushi was surprisingly good- fish was fresh, flavors were on point. BF and I were torn between picking favorites among the rolls: his was the WHITE TIGER (shrimp, takuan, avocado, cucumber, topped with lightly seared super white tuna, soy sauce, bansai sauce) while mine was the KAI'S SPECIL (eel, spicy tuna, avocado, cream cheese, eel sauce). The Cali roll was as expected, and the OH KAMISAMA was good too (shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, topped with seared salmon, tataki, banzai sauce).   Service was attentive up until our bill came- then our guy disappeared for a solid ten minutes for no apparent reason. We were the only patrons present in that part of the restaurant.

D-71aVf4OEczh6TVRqj3zQ.text: Ordered a late night pick-up dinner of 5 assorted rolls and some kimchi. The sushi was very good, and the prices very reasonable.

kF0incFrWlA-_dicKO6iXg.text: WOW! If I could give this place 10 STARS I would. It is that good.  I ordered Kai's Special sushi roll and it just melted in my mouth.  Service was down to earth and spot on.  Don't be turned away from the diversity of nationalities behind the counter.  Easily a MUST STOP for all Japanese enthusiasts, and if you don't, you loose out big.  May seem expensive, but hear, you get what you pay for.  Like a taste of heaven.

5idacn8ve-tvp6ZjJRP0tQ.text: Customer service here is great. A couple of weeks ago I brought in a friend who knew nothing about sushi. He ordered a few rolls including the salmon roll and when it was brought out he said I can't eat this because it is raw. I then told him that the fish in sushi is raw unless specified otherwise. The waiter came around and could tell he hadn't touched it and asked if something was wrong. He said yeah I just really didn't know it was raw and the waiter laughed and said no problem I will take it off the bill. First off it was my friends fault and I am not used to Asian people who work at restaurants having good customer service.  My usual order here is the miso cod and the cucumber salad with crab. Both dishes are executed well. The miso cod is both tender and flakey and the crab salad has a refreshing flavor that pairs well with the miso cod.

a64sT_RajCATM6TxZ0Rqkw.text: Great lunch menu. Service, good.  Food, delicious.   The reason it doesn't get 5 stars is the restaurant itself.  Very dingy, needs updating, restrooms smelled bad, carpets looked gross.   Just close your eyes and open your mouth and you'll be alright!

VoMHwhgU3MowREvWOG8mCA.text: We had an amazing time at this place! Driving up it didn't look like much, and entrance would fool you too. But the food was out of this world! We had sushi and teppanyski, and it was so good that I did not wan to stop eating even though I was full. Highly recommended this place

pFkKehYOyjfQvN-Rq1kJ5Q.text: Really like the decor and seating arrangements, you feel like in a private upscale restaurant. The sushi rolls are quite good, however the small dishes such as teriyaki/udon/etc are overpriced and not impressive.  Good for late night sushi and drinking session but who wants to drive so far from the strip?

zI33AwSbuUCrH6i4vh4JkA.text: this is my favorite place for sushi that doesn't have an all you can eat deal. it looks small from the outside but once you're in you  have a variety of seats from the sushi bar or tables or private booths. my favorite roll is matsui #55. the sashimi is consistently fresh. service is very friendly. if you can't decide what you want by reading it off the menu they have plasma tvs at every booth that show pictures of each roll with their names.   this location has pretty much the same menu as the eastern location. the lake mead location is separately owned and operated with a completely different menu.   they also have a VIP card available that you use each time you eat and it accumulates a 'bonus' which gives you a discount off your next visit after you accumulate $10.

vcrl906l5t1TqabXwrvVlQ.text: Very American style sushi, not what I was expecting. I like the taste of raw fish and don't appreciate nigiri coming from the chef with so much wasabi the fish can't be tasted, especially if that is the experience on the majority of the pieces. Rolls aren't much better, the Aces and Yum Yum were  bland, and in the case of the Aces over powered by sauces. Total price was $90 for two (Friday 6/20/14). If you like Wasabi more than fish, and prefer McDonald's to In&out this place might be for you,  but if you'd like even a hint of tradition or subtle flavors look elsewhere.

BtQDNCLbMYcLppPp3fI_kw.text: My family love coming to this restaurant. It's The Place to come for after hour for their special menu. They have the best tempura crab legs that you can't get anywhere else. My husband introduced me to this place 6 years ago and we have been coming here ever since. Everything on their menu are so delicious and the price is great too. We always take our family and friends here whenever we are in the city or when I come here for business trip. Never miss a dinner here when we are staying at the strip. The staff here are so friendly and awesome. Rudy has been serving us ever since my husband took me here. And he is still here at the restaurant. We come here not just for some great and delicious sushi and tempura crab legs but to visit our friend Rudy too. Love this place!!!

eezSCYiZsetal-kVzmAXaQ.text: Osaka's a Las Vegas classic.  It's been around since before it was fashionable to do this whole sushi thing.    Housed in an older building and older section of the city, the restaurant ambles backward in odd angles, but it provides for different seating areas.  Up front is the sushi bar and traditional table seating, in the middle are Teppan grills, and in the rear are Tatami rooms.   Everything at Osaka is always delicious.  The fish is always fresh and looks appetizing.  I had some of the best tempura of my life here.  The chefs are very accommodating with special requests.  Once I attended a birthday party here with at least 20 - 25 people in attendance, all of whom were coming and going at different times, and the service was great.  Everything was prepared correctly and everyone's separated bills were correct as well.  It might not have the pomp and circumstance that other newer sushi bistros do, but Osaka is a safe bet for delicious, fresh food in a comfortable environment with superb service.

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-bAqM8Qn-ZFiy4U6GZRrcw.text: My new favorite sushi spot, very very very good fish. I used to go to the AYCE spots but once I started eating the sashimi at Osaka I can't stop. The Blue fin tuna is amazing, If you are looking for a really good sushi place in vegas this is it.

UbE0iU2ItAKrrYwFENm-2A.text: I was really excited to try this place after seeing it on Diners, Drive-Ins, ad Dives. We were promptly greeted and seated. The server was very polite and courteous. We ordered, I had the OG Special and my husband ordered chicken fried rice, we also had steamed gyoza. The gyoza was awesome, and the fried rice was really good. We like a little more egg in our fried rice than most so it was perfect for us. My roll was interesting. The rice is crispy like it was grilled or something, which I wasn't expecting because I didn't completely read the description. It was really good, you just have to get passed the square shape, heated, crispyness. As we were getting our food a large party showed up and they got all of the attention. We ran out of water and waited over 20 minutes for a server to bring us our check so we could leave. We would have asked sooner if we had seen them but they were lost in the back with the huge party. Very unfortunate for a place with such outstanding reviews.

FrS10fXJyEbbqfmRT1WNXw.text: I freaking love Osaka.  No joke - I call them for a pick-up order, and they're like, "Evelyn, is that you?"  An intervention may be in order...  At any rate, if you love sushi, check out Osaka.  They're not the cheapest place in town, but it's still better than the strip.  This is no AYCE hack joint; but you can order half-rolls and go to town with the variety - they also have a decent happy hour/late night menu.    My favorites are the Oh Kamis

zFauBu6xMqJWIgcNsFg5og.text: Another nightmare of a restaurant, perfect for those that think that a California Roll (poorly made) is the height of Japanese cuisine.  Rumor is that Yukio Mishima ate here before deciding to kill himself.  1. Ambience: When you first walk in, you think "hey, instead of the pretentious bs overpriced Vegas Hotel Japanese restaurant scene, I may have found one of those amazing hole-in-the-wall spots that will be a great authentic experience"...well, the hole-in-the-wall is right, and in this case, it is just that.   The restaurant is old, dilapidated, and damn confusing to escape from. But if you check it out thoroughly, you can almost smell (um and smell other things to) that this was once a great, great place. It looks like the shell of a restaurant taken over by someone's kid or run by an owner who no longer cares whether he has a customer or not. Perhaps his dog died and he's depressed. Perhaps the dog is one of the menu items.   In fact, when we were there, there were about 4 people in a space that could seat at least 100 or more I would think.  Then there are the prostitutes and what not that like to stop by for their pick up orders. Not the restaurant's fault but certainly, this is an inviting atmosphere for them. Funny part is that they got better service then we did.  2. Service: haahaha! What? What's service? Um. Not on the menu.  Yah, so we sat in front of the most disinterested Japanese sushi chef I have ever experienced outside of wacko Nozawa in LA. But Nozawa is at least an actor. This momo was for real. Rude attitude. Totally didn't give a shit that we were the only customers at the bar, or basically in the restaurant. He was busy in his own world. And then of course, there is the attitude driven little Yakuza wanabee waitress who looks like she needs to focus more on the Hello Kitty art on her nails, then bother with a customer.  When we asked in advance if a certain item was cooked a certain way, and were given incorrect information, they still hesitated, and gave us attitude about taking it back! I mean, we asked in advance! But its our fault that they deep fry what in any normal restaurant is grilled. Oh I speak of YAKITORI. Yes. They deep fry it here so that it has a wonderful brick like consistency. Yum. I guess they didn't read the definition of yakitori, like the part about the "grilling" aspect.  Oh, and when we said our "itadakimasu" and upon any "thank you" to the chef...pin drop...no response. Oh man, he looked annoyed and pissed the entire excruciating meal! Wanted to get my tanto blade from the car and go Watari Tetsuya on his ass but I was more in a Totoro mood. Or maybe Golgo 13. Yes I speak Otaku.  On top of that, no one comes by to see if we need anything. Have to call out for the waitress for water, a plate, a gun, whatever.  3. Food.  This is simple. Gross. Lousy quality fish. Even the salmon was 12th grade. And that is cheap fish to do right. And don't think you can escape into Rolls and Handrolls. You can't. Because they are as bad as everything else. Drenched in sauce to make up for the disgusting taste.  All together...125 dollars and no "thank you" from the retards that run this place. Not impressed is an understatement.   I challenge you to try OSAKA and experience the disaster that spots like Nobu made possible. So now you have two choices in Vegas. Authentic -Fake Disgusting Overpriced and Authentic-Fake OK Overpriced. Either way, there is no Japanese food other than Ichiza and Raku in Vegas. Actually, there is no Japanese food in Vegas. Cause those two options are like McDonalds in Tokyo.   Instead, find a hot Japanese girl or guy, get your Tanto blade, and threaten them to make you a proper dinner. Make sure to check your salmon for parasites, and in the case of Osaka, the chef as well.  P.S. I feel like I may have gone a little over-board in this review and so I apologize to anyone who's feelings I may have hurt, like the a-hole chef who stole 125 dollars out from our wallets and in return gave us horrible service and food.

J_lOA9cZFps_fvJ5IjDLmg.text: Always a sure bet. Had octopus there for the first time this past winter and was impressed.

f1Kjg7tjcuWab5DGMSp-mw.text: Don't let the semi-ghetto, run down exterior deter you from giving this place a try; you'll be delighted to come inside and be able to enjoy Osaka's wonderful menu.  I believe this location has a better happy hour menu than the one in Anthem. Last time I came here, their happy hour started at either 10p or 11p. Now that I think of it, I think this location is the only location with a happy hour menu....  Anyway, my thoughts on the food here can be found on my review of their Anthem location. I will say, their service here is hit or miss and is inconsistent, which I find irritating sometimes.  Kampai to Osaka's top notch menu and cuisine! :)

1YCBPkqngcBulgPmYo4Vzw.text: This is the oldest Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas.  We came here at the recommendation of DDD.  Not a disappointment at all.  You take off your shoes to sit down...we loved it.  On weekends they are open until 2 am and have a late night menu that is very good and reasonable.  Sushi rolls, tempura shrimp and vegetables, teriyaki chicken all good.  If you have a large group I would recommend reservations.  Be sure to ask for Rudy.  He is the bomb!!  This is a place all must try.

gzy-vgAv4vj-RHqk8u7Jyg.text: Came in expecting a 4 star sushi joint ... Coming from the California coast maybe my expectations were too high but ... Cali crunch roll was similar to the sushi at albertsons  which I won't eat ... Veggie tempura so soaked in grease ... Miso soup lacked favor , watery and plain ... Apologized after one bite and maybe half a cup of soup that I can't eat any of this ... And was told to pay for both the tempura and soup ... Highly disappointed and a lesson learned . Blows my mind this place is in business .

qRPu7sswB8lSDlaB0udVGg.text: Great variety, quality, & service! Stopped by for a quick dinner, served right away. A True gem!

we0P2ssHhVcsdeEz1nxHKw.text: The sushi chef was great but he was SUPER busy clearly preparing a huge platter and we had a hard time getting his attention to serve us. The sushi was awesome. But we wanted other items from the menu and had to tell the sushi chef because the waitress NEVER came back. Even after she delivered my husband's dish, she NEVER returned :( For as good of reviews as this place has, we expected better service or even a little bit of service. The entrance is also confusing. Which way do you go in? There needs to be some signage in the weird hallway that you enter. I'd try some where else next time we're here.

Suju-Lou4dL4p9MoaDwzsg.text: Was really looking forward to experience the taste of the food again that I remember from my last trip to Las Vegas.  I was very disappointed in the quality of the food this time around.  Portions were ok though.  The nori used for the sushi rolls was very bad because we spent more time chewing on the nori.  The quality of the nori was just not there.  I love to eat sushi and don't think that I will return to this restaurant in my future trips to Las Vegas.

wpAYZFWmS5hIi1tY0gTV_A.text: Anything less than 4 stars is blasphemy.  If this place were in San Diego they would give Ota-san a run for his money!!

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What chirashi should look like

TKovVj6c4I7vo0IALp5yXw.text: This place really lived up to our expectations.  We love going to teppan grill style restaurants and we have a favorite one back home in California.  So on vacation in Vegas we decided to try this place out.  It was just as good as our place back home and priced about the same.  Our chef, hurricane pho, was awesome and fun.  Would definitely recommend the teppan grill to anyone looking for good affordable food in Vegas.

RPbbjoI9C5oxaEfz3corEA.text: We used to come here a lot but the last few times we were there, the service was really slow so we've stopped coming. Aside from the service, the food was good. They have unique tables that are inset into the floor, so you take off your shoes before sitting & you step down into the booth seat. The parking lot is really small so we often had to park in the lot next door.

dBV1ZosrHfOpWoGfab_Fdw.text: Excellent Food and Excellent Service......We had a last minute reservation for 13 of us and they were happy to accomodate us.  We could not asked for a better experience!

7ZreloZE_py-0rAIZ2ZwYw.text: When first pulling up to the parking lot, don't be scared off like we almost were.  The area is filled with adult themed stores (stripper shoes and attire, adult toys...).  The doors are solid, no windows or anything.  The area looked kind of sketchy.  We decided to go in anyway since the general reviews were good.  I had the chirashi and my wife had the tempura udon (ramen?).  Both were excellent for the price.  Total without drinks or sides was just over $20!  We will definitely come back next time we are in town.

LTdyn0GpsPiQbnxqDlhrAA.text: Extraordinary sushi! We tried the 777, the Kamakaze, and the Oh Kamisama all featured on their late night menu. YUMMMMM! The service was also excellent. We ate at the sushi bar and had speedy and friendly service. So glad to have found this spot!

DwrQif8EX3JhZ46GWMu5FQ.text: My cousin loves this place. We were actually seated at Steak N Shake and we had this epiphany that we should go get sushi instead. So we got up and drove all the way up the I-15 to Osaka.  When you enter, you're greeted by a blank wall. What is this - a Japanese Speakeasy? You then turn right and go through another door that takes you to a small sushi bar area. From this initial view, you'd think the place was tiny. If you continue to the back and left, though, you discover that the place can seat quite a lot of people. They have a Teppanyaki area and a surprising number of private booths and traditional looking Japanese sunken dining tables. The space is very aesthetically pleasing.  Unfortunately, when it came to the food, I was disappointed. I really wasn't that hungry, but I tried everything that my cousin ordered. We stuck to their late night special menu that is available 10pm-2am.  * Beef Tataki Salad - It looked amazing, but it lacked flavor. I think I've only ever had Beef Tataki at Ichiza and theirs runs circles around Osaka's. * King Crab Tempura - This was easily the best thing we ordered. Delicious. * Salmon Skin (half) Roll - This also lacked flavor. I'm kind of a purist in that I like to eat sushi exactly how the chef made it. I never use soy sauce or add wasabi. I stuck to my guns on this, despite the roll really needing the extra flavor. * Screaming Orgasm (ahi sashimi on top of some salad) - This also looked amazing. It had better flavor than the Beef Tataki, but I wasn't blown away by it. The dressing was a little too vinegary.  On the plus side, the service was excellent. The two ladies that served us were extremely friendly and attentive to our needs. The green tea tasted great and was the perfect thing on my still recovering throat. Whenever I was running low on tea, the lady would come back and top it off promptly.  I really hate giving less than three stars, but I must stay True to the rating system. Indeed, I have experienced better. It's too bad because the service and decor of Osaka are top notch.

8mUeNVKuV4dZeyfUIC5tfw.text: My Husband is a chef, he has given me many pearls of wisdom when it comes to choosing a restaurant; for example is the parking lot full? Osaka's is always overflowing!! Do the locals dine there? Locals have been dining here since the 60's. Las Vegas is a young city, so right away that is telling. This restaurant is a Mecca for the cognoscenti (peeps in the know) which includes lifelong residents and the born and raised Las Vegans. They know where the good eats are in this city and Osaka has the goods!! One thing I love is the privacy of the seating which only accentuates the incredible dishes. The service is wonderful! Exceptional wait staff and bus people, not only do they take care of your every need but they are all beautiful to boot!! (Not that that is a prerequisite) but it doesn't hurt. I would encourage everyone, whether you live here or just visiting our unique city, to visit Osaka's Japanese Bistro for a gastronomical delight! Enjoy!!!

u507rIlRwDC5bwluGLKb1g.text: My mom found this and we live in LA. The best Japanese food in Vegas. Yes, don't judge it by the outside or the entry way.  But once you get in, it is just like any other restaurant.   We sat in the tatami room where you take off your shoes sit on the ground around the table. There is actually space to put your feet.  The food is great. Sushi, tempura, boats, udon, or even great appetizers, if you want.  And desserts too!  Would recommend this place to anyone and everyone who wants great Japanese food.

m52EKs8LjCuuq5SUefiMlg.text: This review is long overdue. I've been coming to Osaka on Sahara for the last 20 years. The quality of the fish is consistent, the service is exemplary. When you have sushi chefs like Kenji, Jaime and Oscar you can't go wrong. They have a good variety of sake, and Asahi draft from Japan. This is a great venue, highly recommended!

Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chrashi
Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni with ikura and avocado, topped with Japanese blue green algae. Killer

3B3C-Box_B-eWTj06LKoSQ.text: This place is great! It has dethroned ichiza in my book.  Its a lot bigger! There are at least 4 tatami rooms. The late night menu is insanely good. Service was attentive and the food was fabulous.  The rolls were huge! 10 pieces p/roll! I will be coming back next time I visit Vegas. This will be a regular go to spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ended my meal with coconut bread pudding and ice cream
Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried octopus
Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura

4hqB8en8Wi2l7h7zG9Vfdg.text: I was recommended to come to this delicious Japanese place while on my visit to Las Vegas. We tried the Japanese lasagne, bacon wrapped asparagus, and other traditional sushi rolls. I visited this location with my family and it is very family oriented. Wonderful friendly service and fresh food. Can't wait to come back. Definitely a must try at least once.

OyzIOUxLVIuXpBA46KQVAg.text: Every time we come to vegas we come to osaka... it's defenetly the best sushi you can ever have.

EVXm0BQnY6w5tQtQesMzFA.text: I did a last minute google search and landed on a local Vegas blog that said this place had amazing, fresh, innovative Japanese dishes.... so we went and were wowed. Don't be put off by the seedy area, it is located in the mini-mall with the mini statue of liberty statue and next to the store that sells, um... sexy attire. We were 5 adults and 6 kids and every single one of us were incredibly happy. We showed up for early 6pm dinner and were seated on tatami mats.  The menu is wide and varied, but it had things for picky non-adventurous types and others like me and my BFF who went for urchin and hand rolls and their specialty rolls.. The rolls were innovative. you can order individual yakitori freshly grilled, fresh ebi sashimi with their crispy fried heads, their udon was enjoyed by my 70 year old dad and 5 year old daughter, and the atmosphere made my manga-loving nieces very happy. The waiters handled our big ole table deftly and with patience. I recommend this place to anyone.

HqKB7M026pPQyFUfpmTvdw.text: I went out to Osaka (again) tonight.  I've been going for 35 years.  This was, literally, the BEST meal I have ever had!  The Pocket Ace roll was the most incredible combination of flavors--each bit from each roll we ordered was better then the last.  The menu is always changing, so it is 'new' all the time.  I am normally disappointed with desserts in Asian restaurants, but the ice cream filled fried pound cake was delicate, crispy and sweet.  I loved the fresh blueberries on top.  I've been to restaurants much pricier, but never better!

yh2yA0uP76aMZo_N7qGXxg.text: Huge variety. Rolls were delish. Loved having the option of a half roll. Was able to get multiple rolls. Get the spicy garlic edemome- amazing!

NXZfMwVPk1xEXVRfBU9YkQ.text: I held high expectations of this place due the the praise it had been given by multiple reviewers. But I was throughly disappointed. When I walked in and was lost I walked out one of the servers chased after me to not go out the door bc it would set off an alarm. Thus begins the terrible service from the wait staff. They told me to just walk in even though I had no clue where I was going and were pushy. When I got done and settle with my friends to eat they got my order wrong twice. When I did receive my sashimi I had been disappointed by the size portion and the taste of one of the tunas made my tongue roll over and die. If you are going to serve sashimi at least make it fresh. The waiters were extremely confused when bringing out our dishes and slightly unprofessional where I literally thought they were all high. When it came time for the check I was very angry they included gratuity because the food was mediocre and the service was terrible save for just one waiter. You are better off avoiding this place.

RcvYps89hmWAOmp0WxfkSg.text: Excellent food. Great chef. Lots of food. First time experience for my son's and they are still talking about it... we will be back

zl-nSeR02DPXQkIP3BIqxA.text: First of all Kenji and Himae are fast and friendly so sit at the bar.  The quality of the fish is amazing. I say don't fill up on rice eat sashimi or nigiri pairs.  The garlic tuna( maguru) is delicious. Also try the Shikoku oysters amazing.  I can't say there was anything I didn't like my friend ate 20 pieces of himachi, so it must have been good. Kenji also made me a lemon salmon roll with avocado and cucumber inside which wasn't on the menu. Great people and high quality food!

Z5bZv10fqemP5lwYZnlmzQ.text: Apparently the tepanyaki portion doesn't open until 4. They have a very limited lunch menu. I called before I came down to make sure they were open but they didn't mention the limited menu so when I took a $30 cap from the strip I was very disappointed

9wJID3HCzDpJbjP4ELGKFg.text: I think this place is great!! It's in a good location but since it's not on the strip the prices are average. Very awesome chicken katsu. Also sampled a few other items they had (forgot the names, but they were all good.) The food itself would only get a 3 star rating but the fact they have four different seating options is not only unique but sure to please almost anybody. Plus, our server was very friendly. If you're craving sushi this is the place for you.

SXp0-gxXf1EHX2hpVo9y_A.text: Amazing food, this is always the first stop when my out of state friends are in town. The only thing I would recommend is the waiter/waitresses being a little more attentive when we reach the end of out meal. Sometimes we wait 10 Minutes just to get a check and leave.

kuAVp9eF6FKOD2jvGkR04g.text: Really good sushi, the chefs where really friendly and fast. Disappointed there was no all you can eat. But still had a great time.

CA3DOERyZ4Qun1nJX6UW_A.text: Being from Hawaii I'm  familiar with good Japanese food. I had the shrimp tempura and chicken combo. It came with 4 large shrimp 2 carrots 1 zucchini and onion ring. Tempura batter was light and crispy. On par with the best tempura I've had. The teriyaki chicken came with a light tasting teriyaki sauce. Pleasant and not over powering. My wife had the pork tofu. The broth was excellent. It had a good portion of pork but lacked enough tofu. And the dish was over powered by an over abundance of onion. The price of the entrees was reasonable.

aJRaTZcEkokD7x1A_-Z4FA.text: Delicious japanese food. Order the two boats the Titanic and the Ron. U can't go wRONg. Thank me later

fGgpXILZWIPvao70I3pQgg.text: Thank you Guy Fieri! We were looking for a great local place to eat off the strip while on vacation in Las Vegas and checked the list on the triple D website. I am so glad we did! Osaka is almost like 3 different restaurants in one: a sushi bar, teppanyaki grill and Japanese restaurant. It is located way off the strip in a strip mall. We ate in the Japanese restaurant section that has low tables that you take your shoes off and tuck your feet under. Super fun! We ordered several sushi rolls, firecracker shrimp, miso soup and their house chicken soup. Everything was amazing! We got the Roponngi, Pocket Aces, and Kai Special rolls. My favorite was the Pocket Aces with the crunchy fried onions on top- yum! The rolls weren't super inexpensive but they were big and really fresh. Next time I'll come for happy hour. I'm so glad we tried this place. It's worth the Uber ride.

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Low tables that you tuck your bare feet under while you sit on cushions.

rVaoU3iWJb5h_8-GfFDvzQ.text: Nice atmosphere. Not too crowded for a Friday night. Opted for the traditional seating. Had a couple of roles and tried a couple sake samplers. Overall a good time and would come again.

VeqrHnwkzFwRET8HXjKXkw.text: Food was very good and our server Jared was excellent and made our visit very pleasant. He gave us some suggestions for food selection. Had a great dining experience. A++++

PafVGHZASYAd989Iwogn3w.text: The sushi is fantastic and fresh and the owner Gene is awesome. I had to cater a party for an event and he was super accommodating at the last minute and was able to work within my budget with so many options. I will definitely be using them again!!

pGIE0vCmFsjBMpLAssvBtw.text: I get the veggie sushi and they are the best place in town for non fish sushi. Very creative rolls.  Great service, very authentic atmosphere. They always remember me and how I like things, which is great.  I am loyal to them 100%.

pZQvThC1SVDXp41x9cd7XQ.text: OMG!!Not only is this really authentic Japanese food, they also deliver it direct to your hotel room. Cannot believe my luck that I found Okonimiyaki in Vegas AND didn't even have to leave the comfort of my room to enjoy it

RyDRSULAtIRnuPqgT6B6Og.text: Location feels dated, and it's in a converted night club club or something, it has no windows, feels like a shady basement somewhere. A lot of the detailing is left over from the 1980s. Sushi bar is cramped and boring, only noise is from the tv showing some random show. Though their servers are friendly and helpful, the chefs are not. I dislike the feel of this place immensely.  Sushi and cooking is very average for above average prices. It's fresh enough, but flavors don't pop, nothing stood out, and a lot of their recipes are dated. And the half rolls on their happy hour menu really don't save you much.  They have Tatami rooms and a small teppanyaki grill area that feels like a fire hazard. Area of town is sketchy, parking lot feels unsafe after dark. Not going back.

jDLX3vX7VSFaCA1e0ZWNyQ.text: Authentic Japanese food!! I usually go to Henderson location, which is close to my house. Different ambience. Hidden gem.  Good service. Variety of items.

xK0uDMtPlPTq8q-dVlwujQ.text: Saw this on Triple D's, first sushi place in Vegas, so yeah gotta try this place out. The lighting is dim and it is casual. We sat in a kinda private booth area, no shoes, so you sit crisscross or yes for those that cannot sit that way you can sit as you normally would in a chair there's room for your legs under the table still.   We came in right when they open since we were heading driving back home after.  Sushi was very fresh and good. We came in time for the lunch special and order every roll on the lunch special which can included a few signature ones. Hey why not, we definitely wanted to try it all. For sure it was worth it and we did finish it!   If your craving sushi come give this place a try and get the experience of the semi- traditional seating area.

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sat here for the experience, no shoes in this seating area.

526v8czfZWJu8AlEuCfvcg.text: Simply the best. I've been going here for 20 plus years and never had a bad experience. They have the freshest selections of sushi and a large menu of other great options. The chefs are awesome and helpful.

XDP18JW3ALzrAZrkuWBzjA.text: Osaka Bistro is awesome, if you appreciate quality sushi that is. The sushi/sashimi is fresh and authentic. I got the medium sashimi platter which was enough for four to share. It had a good assortment of fish from snow crab and fresh abalone to hamachi and hirame. I'm drooling just thinking back to that sashimi platter! I also had another platter with the various types of nigiri sushi that I ordered. The amaebi and kinmedai were terrific! The toro melted in my mouth! I also had the shigoku oysters which were fantastic and fresh! There are many other sushi rolls to choose from and a large menu with items from the kitchen if sushi is not your preference. My mom loves their sukiyaki. She and my dad have been coming here for years and now that I've seen why, I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shigoku oysters
Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assortment of nigiri sushi. Delicious!!!
Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium Sashimi Platter

i0wO3mzKDWq3g7s6skg64A.text: A fun & funky place to bring friends and family!! Every time I step into this restaurant it makes me smile to be seated either on the floor or in one of the sunken booths. There's a great atmosphere shared by all.   I was with some sushi newbies, so we didn't venture out too far meal wise on this visit- although they offer quite the creative mix of rolls. I can't wait to try their Treasure Island - complete with capers and sliced onions and the El Pollo Loco, with chicken, asparagus and Japanese salsa! Say What?! That is my kind of loco!   For this occasion, we ordered: *Spicy tuna - a solid basic *Ribeye wrapped around asparagus - meat was on the tough side, with a flavorful sauce and succulent asparagus. Just an okay dish. *Chicken nuggets - the kiddo and big kiddos chowed down on these little nuggets  *Fresh White roll - My favorite roll of the night! Fresh, juicy albacore with hamachi, shaved radish, cucumber and wrapped in soy pap. It was delicate yet hearty. *Kai's Special roll - had some kick. *Lisa Lisa roll - this was kind of a standard, and our table's favorite. How can one go wrong with shrimp tempura done right?  Service has always been wonderful here, I can't think of one occasion where we didn't receive a greeting, smiles, a quick seat, explanations to questions, help ordering for anyone at the table, quick refills, sake flowing; it's all good. In addition to their funky rolls, they offer Special Boats that are quite a feast to the eyes. If you are looking to make an impression on someone, I'd say that's a sure bet. Then there is the Shabu Shabu, Sukiyaki or Yosenabe to try for yet more adventurous options. Life is good here; Adventure on!!

0TJtK-SNIyQLZgVqZjYaaQ.text: Very overpriced compared to other hibachi but service was good , food was good as well. Not my favorite place for hibachi still

FndYNdjVrcs1GLoa2Vm5sg.text: In Vegas for a car show and wanted Sushi....so glad we came here. Food and service were excellent. Kalbi Ribs were beyond excellent. Highly recommend Osaka.

S4qnUIboPANL8ymDTMRduQ.text: The food was amazing!! I had the ramen combination. I picked spicy tuna roll and tonkustu flavor. The order came with a salad, the rolls, ramen and a salad. The gyoza was really crispy. The best I had!!

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu Curry. Delicious
Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramen Combo &amp; Katsu curry
Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramen Combination. Tonkatsu &amp; spicy tuna

wXT2tnU7hX0T5nwMn8uEqw.text: Osaka offers three ways to dine- the sushi bar, the main dining room, and the tatami room. We went to the Sahara Location.  We had the dragon roll and few other which I don't remember the name. I thought the price was high but the sushi was melt in your mouth good. I noticed they had a special free lobster teppan dinner for your birthday with purchase of 5 teppan dinner. Definitely want to try that out.

jgD8-0XSl7XgHETmw-NJ2Q.text: We went here with a big group on a Friday night, a group of 15. There was no wait and the servers were friendly although it took them hella long to get our order even though all of our table was seated. Anyways we ordered beers and sake and we were gonna try the sake sampler nigori flight, but I was told it was super small and not worth it by a friend who had been there before. Anyways for our big group we ordered 3 large boats for 55$ each. I was like whatever because we were with a group but really I am Asian and this deal was the shittiest deal ever.  For 55$ you get 2 half or age slices (so basically 1 whole orange) 15 slices of crappy beef/steak that had no flavor except the teriyaki sauce they dumped onto it. And the chicken looked dry and freeze dried and was absolutely horrible. Also this 55$ boat came with 7 pieces of sushi. I thought it was gonna be at least nigiri but it was actually 2 pieces of salmon, 2 tuna, 2 white albacore and a shitty shittay flavorless imitation California roll. What a disappointment!!! I am so accustomed to have lots of sushi and nigiri and oh the best part of the boat was the tempura. Kinda oily but sadly the best part. I would come here again because I had fun with friends but the food was quite Terrible. We also ordered the Kalbi skewers and it wasn't Kalbi it was more like bi-bim-bap on a stick. Also the steak roll were terrible and dry. And the best thing was the sappo roll. Tasty refreshing and real fish.  The only thing that made this tolerable was the large Sapporo and sake. Ps my friend said the Cole slaw was good.  And also I asked for extra ginger an hour ago and it never came. See attached piece of chicken. It was freeze dried and no one ate it because it looked like rubbery dried intestines.

rGsXjx5uy8-4-jaqu741xg.text: Been coming here since the 1980's... Back again 2017.. Outstanding Great to get away from the Strip!

MbISwOCwpVWCuGPgZLl_jQ.text: Heard about this tasty place ... I will definitely return again and again for the freshness of the sushi. The monkfish liver is far out! And those scallops... yum!  Fresh as Fresh can be in this Japanese restaurant. So authentic, sit on the floor cushions and enjoy the experience. Thank you for the great meals.

G63yDPlKlWTdnLTpLFNL6g.text: I've been here multiple times over the years. Always came for the sushi at lunch.  Started coming for dinner to get the chicken sukiyaki or the pork tofu. Just like home cooking like I remembered it (Hawaii). Staff is friendly and I haven't had a bad meal yet from there.  Highly recommend always a stop when in Vegas.

fd7skj923EVWRUVWAxqZwA.text: My Favorite sushi place!!! I LOVE these Guy's!!! Andy & Oscar are my favorite sushi bar chefs  I am so addicted I come at least once a week during lunch!!! My favorite is the OH KAMISAMA!! They have lunch specials too! Mmmmm forever a fan!  Updated to add: the whole staff here is great!!

DvpNyTN9NjbvH0bs3jGO4w.text: Service was excellent. Husband got two rolls, a kamikaze and caterpillar. He said they were at least a 4/5. I had the teriyaki chicken meal and it was just the right amount of food with wonderful flavor. We will definitely be back when his sushi craving hits.

Ev_HC2X5PikVHac_e8qO5A.text: Hmmm. Well, I must say the presentation is some of the best I've ever seen; however, the slices of various Sashimi (Small Plate = $45) were not as thick as I'm accustomed to. Wonderful flavors in every dish we ordered, but portions are on the small side. Being charged for green tea and rice are also not the norm for me, either. All told, that may be the deal-breaker.

0yaT-9VDkK7aXSxDp8qnVg.text: Really good, fresh food.  5 stars is well deserved and the waitress was knowledgeable and very attentive. We were stuffed when we left. The rolls were delicious and the steak and chicken ala cart were good also. Highly recommend this place just like everyone else.

brSVgBxiAECpMiqLMdNwgg.text: Our absolute favorite sushi place in town. Their Japanese Lasagna is perfection! They use very good grade sushi; generous portions. We have eaten at the sushi bar or the traditional tables. They also have great hibachi; super flavorful! Love every roll we have tried here.

LHChYLnLMXzExAVBixgOOA.text: Fresh, Yummy Sushi!  big portions, fast customer service.  The green tea is authentic and the miso soup has plenty of sea weed!  Favorite rolls - spicy tuna and volcano roll.  Parking is plenty - at night it's busy, but plenty of street parking.   Enjoy !

LUlQ1Pzvexv2g6imxtsOZw.text: Food was good, wait staff was nice, chef's cook with good quality and nice speed. Only thing I hate about this place is how small it is. It's always over crowded and people always squeezing by next to you behind you bumping into each other. If they moved to a bigger locale I'd be there all the time. I'd recommend but won't return to the sardine can.

ku7bIBWWvC_Q8vE-POJB3g.text: I was extremely disappointed. I did have my food delivered, so i guess I  missed out on the dining experience of the actual resteraunt which, from the photos, looks nice.    I ordered the soft shell crab, shrimp tempura, firecracker shrimp, korean kalbi short ribs, and fried tofu. In total my order cost over $70.00. For that price I expect deliciousness; what I got was buyer's remorse.   The food arrived cold. Disappointingly included in my order was one small box of white rice and three containers of what had to be miso soup (which i did not order) but NO teriyaki, ponzu, or any kind of dipping sauce. I ate my tempura dry. The korean short ribs were so incredibly chewy I spat them out. The fried tofu was soggy and bland with a few spring onions thrown in the box. The softshell crab was dry with no flavor. It came with a cream sauce that was extremely runny compared to similar sauces I've had. The only redeeming dish was the firecracker shrimp - it was seasoned well, the texture was great, and it had just enough spice to make it tasty with a kick.  Overall the food was bland, dry, sloppily packaged for delivery, and a huge let down. I would not recommend.

l1OkQIW3iA_Qkycn_eo0ug.text: Been coming here for the past 10 years and we can't have enough of this place, tried a lot of places in Vegas but this place Rocks!!! The Sushi Chef Jaime knows what we like and we don't , as soon as you walk in the door they will greet you and call you by your name of course if you come here often like we do lol! Everything is fresh ready to serve as order! Tried pretty much everything off the menu and what can I say? It's really good! Highly recommend this place for Family, friends or even date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese Lasagna Roll x2

mKFMlNg5UpPLelGN2NZ1jw.text: Lol just walked in there. Kind of laughable how 3 servers and a bartender were have a wonderful conversation at the bar NOT acknowledging customers who walk in. Disappointing. I mean you can stare at us, but like are we going to be seated by you or serve ourselves? Walked out. Never got a chance to eat at the restaurant. Will not be returning.

VwnlDMqK4-Wfr8y0RGgZcg.text: These reviews have to be fake. This place is awful. The bathroom smelled like sewer. The food was poor quality considering how expensive the teppan experience is. The staff is not attentive and they don't even take a credit card unless it has a chip!

lLTRfWCR78WFe3mFEs-ROw.text: I love this place. Food is great and authentic. The place is very relaxing especially the tatami booths that they have. It's a great place for friends and family.

_B2tLHjmN6ASySo8UierYw.text: I randomly stumbled upon this little gem on my way to the camera shop down the street. I came for lunch on a Thursday and there were 5 other patrons there, who seemed to be regulars. This is a non-tourist, low-key casual spot; my kind of place when I'm bumming it during the week.  The decor is a bit dated, but that's irrelevant because the food and service make up for it in every way.  Our waitress, Misu, was sweet and attentive and the sushi was ultra fresh.  I'll definitely be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Osaka Japanese Bistro - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3/4 pieces of the super fresh spicy tuna lunch size roll

pRXJ5MjtpjQ0n1jOR68IPQ.text: Absolutely LOVE this place, great quality and great prices. Staff were kind and professional, clean and quiet place. New favorite spot. Love love love

9aI6Qrk3DuyPxFPqV9lGYA.text: This place was decent.  I came here for the first time tonight, I ordered the following: Hot green tea 1/2 911 roll  O.G roll Spicy edamame  Miso soup.  911 roll wasn't spicy like I was hoping but still pretty good, and the OG roll had good flavors but I think mine was burnt because it was tough to chew.  The spicy edamame was undercooked and weird. Couldn't finish it. Miso soup was good, and my green tea never stayed empty for long. I'll come back for non sushi items next time because the sushi is over priced for the quality you're getting. Love the tatami mat sections. The carpet is old and needs to be replaced and the bathroom was pretty much out of soap.  The service was great but the rest was mediocre. I'll try it again though because I want to like it.
